question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves in the same manner as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement indicating that Joe Biden will neither seek nor accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Further details and additional context can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users who are deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf to request early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, unambiguous, and made publicly by Biden or his campaign, leaving no possibility of him accepting the nomination for the 2024 election.

Given this, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM? Resolves YES if it is >46.6% at that time, and NO otherwise.

This analysis considers the impact of Biden's decision on Harris's perceived chances in the model, as tracked on Nate Silver's platform.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden declare that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's chances of victory improve according to Nate Silver's projections?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: Joe Biden publicly states before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This declaration must be clear, unequivocal, and made by Biden or his campaign, eliminating any chance of him running for the 2024 election.

In light of this, will Kamala Harris's likelihood of winning in the Electoral College, as per Nate Silver's projections, exceed 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM? The resolution is YES if it is greater than 46.6% at that moment, and NO otherwise.

This evaluation examines how Biden's choice influences Harris's estimated probabilities in the model, as monitored on Nate Silver's platform.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? (b) Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(b) Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? (b) Will Kamala's chances of winning rise in the upcoming week according to Nate Silver's model?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered as No.

(b) Will Kamala's chances of winning increase in the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This will resolve as YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will resolve as NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or prevented from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is removed or blocked from a primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will he be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024. This removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, and is not reversed by that date.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution is based on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the eventual outcome of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump is disqualified or prevented from appearing on a primary ballot due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will he still become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or prevented from being on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024. This disqualification or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources, and must not be overturned by that date.

Then, can it be said that Donald Trump will be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The determination is contingent upon the choices made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the final result of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (2) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. Note that the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (1) Donald Trump is either removed or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (2) Donald Trump becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if both of the subsequent conditions are satisfied:

1. By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or credible media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial declarations will not be sufficient for resolution. It is important to note that this question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the defined criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or barred from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being removed or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

2. Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election. The identity of the individual who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 U.S. election is irrelevant; the determination is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently being discussed; additional options may emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump Jr. being the Republican nominee, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If this condition is met, then the question resolves as **No** for Asa Hutchinson, as only one candidate can be the nominee.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Donald Trump Jr. must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Asa Hutchinson must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, which is impossible if Donald Trump Jr. is the nominee. Therefore, if Donald Trump Jr. is the nominee, this resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Assuming Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican candidate, will Asa Hutchinson also become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will yield a **Yes** if the Republican National Convention designates Donald Trump Jr. as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Should this occur, the answer will be **No** for Asa Hutchinson, since only one individual can be the candidate.

Criteria for resolution regarding the condition: Donald Trump Jr. must be appointed by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the candidate.
Criteria for resolution regarding the outcome: Asa Hutchinson must be appointed by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the candidate, which cannot happen if Donald Trump Jr. is the candidate. Thus, if Donald Trump Jr. is the candidate, this will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson are selected by the Republican National Convention as nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other combinations of candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson secure the Republican nominations for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson are chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other combination of candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be introduced in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on the selections made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: If Joe Biden dies before Saturday, will he remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before Saturday, with an official announcement of his death made before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden pass away prior to Saturday, will he still hold the office of President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario is accurate: Joe Biden passes away before Saturday, with an official declaration of his death issued before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 

Criteria for resolving the condition: Resolves YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden continues to be the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (The Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

If the condition is not satisfied, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (b) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET).

Resolves NO if either Joe Biden does not die before the specified time or he does not remain President through the specified time. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect the resolution regarding his presidency.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away prior to Saturday and continue to serve as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) An official statement regarding Joe Biden's death is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, and (b) Biden continues to hold the office of US President until the end of July 2024 (ET).

This resolves to NO if either Joe Biden does not pass away before the specified time or he does not retain the presidency through the specified duration. A temporary handover of power under the 25th amendment does not influence the resolution concerning his presidency.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris be president by this Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If not, the market will conclude with a "No".

The main source for resolving this market will be official announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable news reports will also be taken into account.

Resolver

question.title: Given Kamala Harris is president by Friday, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This would be confirmed by official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Then, is it true that President Joe Biden will drop out or be otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time? If he does, the answer is yes; otherwise, it is no.

para_P.title: If Kamala Harris assumes the presidency by Friday, will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This would be validated by official announcements from the US government or a consensus among reliable news sources.

Then, can we say that President Joe Biden will either withdraw from the race or be otherwise unable to continue before midnight Eastern Time on July 20? If so, the answer is yes; if not, then the answer is no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris is President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, and (b) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

(b) Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Kamala Harris assumes the role of President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, and (b) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable reports will also be considered.

(b) Joe Biden either withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members of the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s move to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, arguing that this undermines the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are still quite concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 members of the House or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also suffice to resolve this market to YES.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market's closing time, this market will resolve to NO.

Resolution source for the outcome: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point prior to midnight July 20 Central Time, it is evident that 10 or more Democratic Senators exist, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will happen: (a) At least 20 Democrats in the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden early, and (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) Background from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating to express their opposition to their party's attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, arguing that it suppresses the crucial ongoing dialogue regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO serves as the first public indication from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and, through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it functions,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He refrained from confirming the letter's existence.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who are part of the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice for this market to resolve to YES. 

If these conditions are not satisfied by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

(b) Source for resolution: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If, before midnight on July 20 Central Time, it is evident that 10 or more Democratic Senators are calling for this, then this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

Given this condition, the question then asks: Will 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources? The resolution criteria for the condition is that 5 or more countries must win their first-ever Olympic medal. The resolution criteria for the outcome is that 5 or more countries must win their first-ever Olympic gold medal.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five named Democratic House Representatives or Senators press Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local media that they no longer believe Biden can win in November.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more hectic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one is intended to urge Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with these activities.

This market will resolve to YES if a collective of at least five named Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators collaborate to ask Joe Biden to reflect on ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter as mentioned above, or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden in person and jointly requesting him to withdraw.

This market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same unified message. If five individuals independently express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, it will not be sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden with a request for him to step aside will not meet this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's closing date. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond reasonable doubt, the market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, the market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Given at least 5 Democratic lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, will he announce not accepting the nomination before July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: If a minimum of five Democratic lawmakers urge Biden to withdraw before July 20, will he declare that he is not accepting the nomination by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have communicated to local news that they believe Biden cannot win in November.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these would request Biden to cease his campaign, as per five individuals acquainted with the situation.

This market will conclude with a YES if at least five named Democratic Party members from the US House or US Senate collectively ask Joe Biden to contemplate withdrawing from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter as mentioned above, or it might involve a group speaking to Biden in person and jointly requesting him to withdraw.

For a YES resolution, all five individuals must be part of the same group communication. Merely having five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should exit is insufficient.

Any reports of an unspecified number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden to request he step down will not meet this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market closes. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, the market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, the market will resolve as NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:

This question will be resolved as YES if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will neither seek nor accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

To qualify for a YES resolution, the statement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024 (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of unnamed democrats will not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. If these criteria are not met, this condition resolves NO.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made prior to the deadline, this condition resolves NO.

This combined question resolves YES if both (a) and (b) occur as described above.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following two events will take place: (a) A collective of no fewer than five specified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden declares prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) A coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators must collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 re-election efforts, or to press him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be executed by signing a letter or through another method, such as a group meeting with Biden directly. All five individuals must communicate as part of the same group initiative. Reports mentioning unnamed Democrats will not fulfill this requirement unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the cutoff date. If these conditions are not satisfied, this clause resolves to NO.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must issue a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will neither pursue nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal and definitive, leaving no possibility for Biden to accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this clause resolves to NO.

This combined inquiry resolves to YES if both (a) and (b) occur as specified above.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and with **NO** if it is not.

"Accessible to the general public" means that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN (potentially requiring a subscription). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as was the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the main web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be regarded as a positive outcome if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting inquiries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Latvia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Latvia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Latvia fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Given Latvia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Belgium also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Given this, will Belgium also qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria for Belgium: Resolves YES if Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If Latvia secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Belgium also make it through?

Criteria for Belgium's resolution: Resolves to YES if Belgium competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Resolves to NO in all other cases.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Latvia and Belgium participate in their respective Semi-finals and are then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Latvia or Belgium does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

Conversely, if either Latvia or Belgium fails to qualify, the response will be **No**.

- For Luxembourg, it resolves as true if Luxembourg qualifies for the Grand Final as announced by EBU. If Luxembourg does not qualify, it resolves as false.

If either or both do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Ireland and Luxembourg set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Ireland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Luxembourg takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the EBU as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not secure a spot, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Given Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?

The statement must be clear and definitive. If such an announcement is not made by that time, this question will be resolved as No.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be deemed a NO.

question.title: Given Joe Biden dies before Saturday, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before Saturday. This means there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Then, is it true that the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will be a woman? This resolves “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday, will the nominee for the 2024 Democratic Presidential election be a female?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden passes away before Saturday. This implies there will be an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th. Then, is it accurate to say that the nominee for the 2024 Democratic Presidential election will be a female? This will be considered “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates choose a woman as the presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and “no” if/when the Democratic delegates choose a man as the presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday (b) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Woman?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.
(b) Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen: (a) Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday (b) The Democratic Party's nominee for President in 2024 is a woman?
para_P.body:
(a) Will be considered YES if there is a formal announcement regarding Joe Biden's death before the markets close on Friday, July 26th. If not, it will be deemed NO.
(b) Will be marked as “yes” if and when the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential nomination in 2024. It will be marked as “no” if and when a male candidate is selected by the Democratic delegates for the presidential nomination in 2024.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the chosen candidate for the Republican party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is not influenced by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024?

para_P.title: If Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is independent of who gets the Republican nomination on election day in 2024; it is determined only by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Is it accurate to state that Donald Trump will be charged or indicted for any remarks concerning potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (2) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(1) Vivek Ramaswamy will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(2) Donald Trump will be charged with witness tampering in Georgia if he is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in 'The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al'. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (2) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) Vivek Ramaswamy will become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if the Republican National Convention selects him as their nominee. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is the nominee on election day in 2024.

(2) Donald Trump will be charged with witness tampering in Georgia if he faces charges or is indicted regarding any statements about potential witnesses in 'The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al'. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
question.body:
Resolves YES if she appears in the movie in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources. 

[image]https://people.com/will-taylor-swift-play-dazzler-in-deadpool-and-wolverine-8651310

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of Taylor Swift making a cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
para_P.body: This will be considered TRUE if she is seen in the film in any capacity, including if only her voice is utilized for a character. It will also be regarded as TRUE even if she is not listed on IMDB, provided it is verified by other credible sources.

question.title: Conditional on Taylor Swift's cameo, will Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Taylor Swift appears in the movie 'Deadpool and Wolverine' in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. This will still be considered true even if she is not credited on IMDB, as long as it is confirmed by independent sources.

Then, will 'Deadpool & Wolverine' have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie? Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie. The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

The record for the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M globally ($152.2M domestic). This market will resolve YES if 'Deadpool x Wolverine' grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release.

In summary, if Taylor Swift cameos in the movie, will it break the record for the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie?

para_P.title: If Taylor Swift makes a cameo, will 'Deadpool & Wolverine' achieve the highest opening weekend for an R-rated film?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Taylor Swift is featured in 'Deadpool and Wolverine' in any capacity, even if she only lends her voice to a character. This holds true even if she isn't listed on IMDB, provided it is verified by independent sources.

Then, will 'Deadpool & Wolverine' set the record for the largest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film? Analysts are forecasting an enormous opening weekend for the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover. The film, helmed by Shawn Levy and featuring Ryan Reynolds, is anticipated to generate between $340 million and $360 million worldwide in its opening weekend. This would establish the record for the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated film. In the domestic market, the film is expected to launch with $160 million to $170 million, making it the highest R-rated opening of all time.

The current record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated film is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5M globally ($152.2M domestically). This market will conclude with a YES if 'Deadpool x Wolverine' earns more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports AND the Hollywood Reporter (or a similar publication) acknowledges it as the record for an R-rated film release.

To summarize, if Taylor Swift appears in the film, will it surpass the record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated movie?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Taylor Swift will cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine, and (b) Deadpool & Wolverine will have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
Resolves YES if both of the following happen:

(a) Taylor Swift appears in the "Deadpool x Wolverine" movie in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. This will resolve YES even if she is not credited on IMDB, as long as her appearance is confirmed by independent sources.

(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" movie grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports, and the Hollywood Reporter (or an equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release.

para_P.title: Are both of these events going to take place: (a) Taylor Swift will have a cameo in the Deadpool and Wolverine film, and (b) Deadpool & Wolverine will achieve the highest opening weekend ever for a movie rated R?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Taylor Swift makes an appearance in the "Deadpool x Wolverine" film in any capacity, even if it's just her voice for a character. It will still resolve to YES if she is not listed on IMDB, provided that her participation is verified by independent sources.

(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" film earns over $284.5 million worldwide during its opening weekend, according to reports, and is recognized by the Hollywood Reporter (or a similar publication) as the record holder for the highest opening weekend for an R-rated film.
