question.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will the Republicans retain Ohio's 6th district in 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, public, and official, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle. Given this scenario, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election? This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden declares he will not seek the Democratic nomination, will the Republicans keep control of Ohio's 6th district in 2024?
para_P.body: Assume the following holds true: Joe Biden makes a definitive, public, and official announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This statement must leave no doubt regarding Biden's acceptance of the nomination for the 2024 election cycle. Under this condition, will the Republican Party maintain ownership of Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously represented by Bill Johnson) during the 2024 special election? This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if reliable sources indicate that a representative of the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for OH's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports, an Ohio State source or official statement will be referenced. If no election occurs prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(b) Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?

This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden makes an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating he will not run for the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) the Republican Party keeps control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Is Joe Biden going to declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This inquiry will be answered with Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not seek nor accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a Yes resolution, the statement must be straightforward and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election cycle. If such a conclusive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as No.

(b) Will the Republican Party maintain its hold on Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously occupied by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?

This question will be answered with Yes if reliable sources indicate that a candidate representing the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports, an Ohio State source or announcement will be referenced. If no election takes place before January 1, 2025, the question will be voided.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if, after the date of this question's release and before May 1, 2024, trustworthy reports suggest that an assault linked to Israel and taking place within the territory of Iran has resulted in the fatalities of at least five persons.

question.title: Conditional on Israel carrying out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, will Iran's Guardian Council approve Mahmoud Ahmadinejad as a presidential candidate?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Israel carries out an attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, leading to the death of at least five individuals, as indicated by credible reports. Then, will Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran? This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If Israel executes a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024, will Mahmoud Ahmadinejad be sanctioned as a candidate for president by Iran's Guardian Council?
para_P.body: Assuming the following scenario occurs: Israel conducts an assault within Iran before May 1, 2024, resulting in the deaths of at least five people, as confirmed by reliable sources. In this case, will Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name appear on the list of candidates approved by Iran's Guardian Council for the presidential election? This inquiry will yield a response of **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is listed among the qualified candidates for the upcoming presidential election by Iran's Guardian Council. If the initial condition is not satisfied, the response will be N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, and (b) Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
question.body: (a) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. (b) This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) Israel executes a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024, and (b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is listed among the approved candidates for Iran's presidency by the Guardian Council?
para_P.body: (a) This question will resolve **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, there are credible reports confirming that an attack attributed to Israel has occurred within Iran, resulting in the deaths of at least five people. (b) This question will resolve **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad appears on the Guardian Council's list of eligible candidates for the forthcoming presidential election in Iran.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Will Hurd be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for P: Biden must drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.
Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If Biden withdraws prior to July 20, will Will Hurd become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario holds: Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. In that case, will Will Hurd be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Criteria for resolving P: Biden must withdraw or be incapacitated from continuing the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20.
Criteria for resolving Q: Resolves to YES if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves to NO otherwise.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Will Hurd is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time, this part will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.
(b) This part will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this part, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Biden exits the race prior to July 20, 2024, and (b) Will Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This segment will be marked as yes if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed in the race before July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. If not, it will be marked as no.
(b) This segment will be marked as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is open to candidates not currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this segment, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is not pertinent; it will be determined solely by the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. Additional candidates may be introduced in the future beyond those currently listed.

For the purpose of this question, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the determination is based solely on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Vivek Ramaswamy being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite credible media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: If Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Rishi Sunak not secure a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming that Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Rishi Sunak not succeed in being elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election scheduled for July 4, 2024?

Criteria for the condition: Resolves **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen as the candidate by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will resolve as **No**.

Criteria for the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not get elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election for any reason. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, the question will resolve as **No**. Resolution should reference credible media sources or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate (if he is running in any constituency).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. 

For condition (1), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For condition (2), the question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this condition will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Is it true that both: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak will not win a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Rishi Sunak does not succeed in being elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024. 

For criterion (1), the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is strictly based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For criterion (2), the question will resolve as **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not get elected as a Member of Parliament for any reason in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, this criterion will resolve as **No**. The resolution should reference [reliable](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news sources or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate (if he is running in any constituency).

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that time.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

question.title: If Biden remains President through July 2024, will Trump be removed from any state ballot under 14th Amendment Section 3?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden remains the President of the United States through the end of July 2024. This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not affect this status.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The resolution is "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question strictly pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not consider legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after this date. If Trump is removed or blocked and then reinstated such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Should Biden continue as President until the end of July 2024, will Trump face disqualification from any state ballot due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden continues to serve as the President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024. This implies he neither resigns, passes away, nor otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th Amendment, which appoints his Vice President as the Acting President, does not change this situation.

Then, can we assert that Donald Trump will be disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This will be considered "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position according to the stipulations of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. The answer will be "No" if these circumstances are not fulfilled as of July 15, 2024. Note: The inquiry strictly relates to the situation as of July 15, 2024, and does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals after this date. If Trump is disqualified or barred and then reinstated such that he is not disqualified or barred as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024, and will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

Both conditions must be met for this question to resolve as "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to be President until the end of July 2024, and will Donald Trump be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with "Yes" if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. Biden stays in office as President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET). This will be answered with "No" if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) will not lead to a "Yes" resolution, as the Acting President is not the same as the President under the Constitution.

2. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from being on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or credible media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution. The question will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024. Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may occur after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

Both criteria must be satisfied for this question to resolve as "Yes".

question.title: Will OpenAI publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that OpenAI will release a report detailing the findings from independent red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI issues a *public* report containing the results from an *external* entity that has red-teamed the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Given OpenAI publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, will Anthropic do the same?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI publishes a *public* report with results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024. 

Then, will Anthropic also publish a *public* report with results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by the same date?

Resolution criteria for OpenAI: Resolves YES if OpenAI publishes such a report by June 30, 2024.
Resolution criteria for Anthropic: Resolves YES if Anthropic publishes such a report by June 30, 2024.

para_P.title: If OpenAI releases a report detailing the findings from independent red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, will Anthropic follow suit?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: OpenAI issues a *public* report with findings from an *independent* entity red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024. 

Then, will Anthropic also issue a *public* report with findings from an *independent* entity red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by the same deadline?

Resolution criteria for OpenAI: Resolves YES if OpenAI releases such a report by June 30, 2024.
Resolution criteria for Anthropic: Resolves YES if Anthropic releases such a report by June 30, 2024.

question.title: Will both OpenAI and Anthropic publish reports with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, both OpenAI and Anthropic publish *public* reports with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of their AI models. Specifically: (a) OpenAI publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. (b) Anthropic publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Are both OpenAI and Anthropic expected to release reports detailing findings from independent assessments of their models' safety by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be considered **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, both OpenAI and Anthropic issue *public* reports containing the findings from an *independent* assessment of the safety of their AI models. In particular: (a) OpenAI must issue a public report with findings from an independent assessment of the safety of one of their AI models. (b) Anthropic must issue a public report with findings from an independent assessment of the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Are new tariffs or duties on the import of Chinese electric vehicles expected to be announced by the European Union prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared the imposition of new tariffs or duties applicable to the import of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Given the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024, will at least 5 Dem House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the potential link between two political events. Suppose the following is true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles. Given this scenario, is it true that a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators will work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For the outcome to resolve as YES:
- The EU must announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024.
- At least five named Democratic House Members or Senators must collectively pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, through a group action, such as signing a letter or a collective in-person request.

If either of these conditions is not met, the question resolves NO.

para_P.title: If the EU implements new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, will a minimum of five Democratic Members of the House or Senate exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible connection between two political occurrences. Assume the following holds true: Before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has put forth new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles. Given this situation, is it accurate to say that a coalition of at least five specified Democratic Party members from the US House or US Senate will collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For the answer to be YES:
- The EU must unveil new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles ahead of July 5, 2024.
- A group of at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators must jointly pressure Biden to withdraw before July 20, 2024, through a collective action, such as signing a letter or making a group in-person appeal.

If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, the resolution will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (2) at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(1) The first condition will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) The second condition will resolve as **Yes** if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter, as reported, or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (1) the EU will declare new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, and (2) at least five specific Democratic House Members or Senators will pressure Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) The first condition will be considered **Yes** if, by July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the implementation of new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) The second condition will be deemed **Yes** if a minimum of five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate halting his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could involve signing a letter, as reported, or engaging in another format such as a group discussion with Biden in person, collectively urging him to withdraw. All five individuals must be part of the same collective message. If five individuals each separately express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, this will not suffice for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats communicating with Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's conclusion. In cases of ambiguity regarding such names being reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards resolving NO. If these stipulations are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will determine a “Yes” outcome if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a higher likelihood of winning than Joe Biden on that same date. In the event that both candidates are shown to have equal probabilities, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically utilizing the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations to the methods used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate these figures will not affect the resolution of this market.

The market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is available. It may not resolve until the datapoints for July 20 are released. If there are no available datapoints for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve according to the closest previous figures available prior to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution refers to the winning odds of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Given 538 projects Biden as the favorite on Friday, will Kamala Harris’ VP pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected by FiveThirtyEight to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump, as indicated by the blue trend line on the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast. This is based on the data available for July 19, with the resolution occurring as soon as July 20 data is available, or by July 22 if July 19 data is missing.

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris will announce her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, 2024? This resolves YES if Kamala Harris confirms either Kelly or Shapiro as her VP pick, and NO if she confirms anyone else.

The resolution criterion for the condition is based on FiveThirtyEight's data, while the outcome is based on Kamala Harris' announcement.

para_P.title: With 538 projecting Biden as the frontrunner on Friday, will Kamala Harris choose either Kelly or Shapiro as her VP?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: On July 19, 2024, FiveThirtyEight forecasts that Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, as shown by the blue trend line in the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast. This is derived from the data available on July 19, with the determination made as soon as data from July 20 is accessible, or by July 22 if the July 19 data is absent.

Then, is it accurate that Kamala Harris will reveal her selection for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro prior to August 7th, 2024? This will be considered a YES if Kamala Harris officially names either Kelly or Shapiro as her VP, and a NO if she names someone else.

The resolution criterion for the condition is based on FiveThirtyEight's data, while the outcome hinges on Kamala Harris' announcement.

question.title: Will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, and will Kamala Harris choose Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her VP pick?
question.body: This question resolves to 'Yes' if both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024, as per the blue and red trend lines on https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/; and (b) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7, 2024, confirmed by Kamala herself. The resolution of FiveThirtyEight's forecast will wait for the July 20 datapoints to become available, and if unavailable by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19. The VP pick resolves when confirmed by Kamala Harris.

para_P.title: On July 19, 2024, will FiveThirtyEight indicate that Biden is the frontrunner, and will Kamala Harris select either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her vice presidential candidate?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if both of the following conditions are met: (a) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden must have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump, as illustrated by the blue and red trend lines found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/; and (b) Kamala Harris must declare her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro prior to August 7, 2024, with confirmation from Kamala herself. The outcome of FiveThirtyEight's forecast will depend on the availability of data from July 20, and if such data is not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will be determined based on the closest previous data to July 19. The resolution of the vice presidential selection will occur once it is confirmed by Kamala Harris.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Liz Cheney going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other contenders will be marked as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be an announcement from Joe Biden before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement declaring that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:

In this context, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the figure recorded for that date shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, resulting in a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

Then, is the following true? Will Joe Biden or his campaign make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President for another term in the 2024 cycle?

Will Joe Biden or his campaign issue a clear, public, and official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, confirming that he will not pursue and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President for another term in the 2024 election cycle?

question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. (b) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves as **Yes**. If either condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen: (a) Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

(a) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead.

(b) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement that he will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unmistakable and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle.

If both criteria are met, the inquiry resolves as **Yes**. If either criterion is not met, the inquiry resolves as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Kamala Harris becoming President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This determination will be based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Then, is the following true? Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves YES if he remains President, and NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

para_P.title: If Kamala Harris is designated as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, will Biden still be in office until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario: Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This conclusion will rely on verified information from the US government or a consensus of reliable news sources.

Under these circumstances, is it accurate to say that Joe Biden continues to serve as US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET)? This is a YES if he remains in office, and a NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. It is important to note that a temporary power shift under the 25th amendment, which appoints his Vice President as Acting President, does not result in a YES outcome, as the roles of Acting President and President are distinct according to the Constitution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting; and (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET), without resigning, dying, or otherwise ceasing to be President before then. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not affect the resolution of this question.

A temporary handover of power under the 25th amendment, which designates his Vice President as Acting President, does not influence the outcome of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made by 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Given Nvidia's market cap is larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, the market capitalization of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Then, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

Resolution criteria for this outcome: 
- This resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).
- This could be by signing a letter, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.
- All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.
- Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO.
- If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

- All five individuals must be part of the same collective message. Five individuals separately expressing to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient for a YES resolution.
- Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden asking him to step aside will not fulfill this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are disclosed before the market's closing date. In any ambiguous situations where such names are reported but not confirmed with reasonable certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.
- If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve as NO.

question.body:
This question resolves positively if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal in any event during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. Track and field events will start on Thursday, Aug. 1, and conclude on Sunday, Aug. 11. Sha'Carri Richardson is scheduled to compete on the following days:
- Women's 100m: Friday, Aug. 2, to Saturday, Aug. 3
- Women's 4x100m Relay (lineups not yet announced): Thursday, Aug. 8, to Friday, Aug. 9

(b) France places in the top 5 in the medal table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games: (a) Sha'Carri Richardson secures a gold medal and (b) France finishes in the Top 5?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered affirmatively if both of these criteria are satisfied:

(a) Sha'Carri Richardson achieves a gold medal in any event during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. The track and field competitions are set to begin on Thursday, August 1, and will end on Sunday, August 11. Sha'Carri Richardson is expected to participate on these dates:
- Women's 100m: Friday, August 2, to Saturday, August 3
- Women's 4x100m Relay (lineups yet to be confirmed): Thursday, August 8, to Friday, August 9

(b) France ranks in the top 5 on the medal table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is determined by the total number of medals earned by each participating nation, ranked by:
1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of ties for 1) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of ties for 2) Total Bronze Medals

The question will be considered unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will GUE/NGL secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and as **No** for all other political factions. In the event that two factions are equally positioned in terms of seats, both will be deemed as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

question.title: Given that GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Greens–EFA also hold the most seats?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This question resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group also holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, meaning both groups are tied for the most seats. It resolves as **No** if Greens–EFA does not hold the most seats. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: If GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will the Greens–EFA also secure the highest number of seats?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group also secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, indicating that both groups are equal in the number of seats. It will be answered with **No** if the Greens–EFA does not secure the highest number of seats. The resolution of this question will depend on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will both GUE/NGL and Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both the GUE/NGL and the Greens–EFA political groups hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This can occur if both groups are tied for the most seats. The question will resolve as **No** if neither or only one of the groups holds the most seats.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will GUE/NGL and the Greens–EFA each secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both the GUE/NGL and the Greens–EFA political factions secure the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. A tie for the most seats between the two groups will also result in a **Yes**. Conversely, the outcome will be **No** if neither or just one of the factions achieves the highest number of seats.

The resolution of this question will depend on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media coverage.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he receive at least a 3% increase in support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a standard Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion regularly indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump by a margin greater than the margin of error, while every other Democrat tested in these hypothetical scenarios either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the broader electorate?

This market will resolve to YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more when both polls are closed.

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Others)). The answer is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve to N/A, and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Given Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. This will be determined by comparing two Manifold polls that close on July 6. One poll includes Joe Biden on the hypothetical ballot, and the other includes a generic Democrat. The condition is met if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more, calculated using the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).

Then, is it true that the USD will be worth >= 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024? This will be resolved according to the USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

para_P.title: If Trump achieves a minimum of 3% support among Manifold participants when compared to Biden rather than a generic Democrat, will the USD be valued at 145 JPY or more at the close on August 9th, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario holds: When up against Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump secures at least 3% more support among Manifold participants. This will be established by analyzing two Manifold polls that conclude on July 6. One poll features Joe Biden on the hypothetical ballot, while the other has a generic Democrat. The condition is satisfied if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll surpasses that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or greater, determined using the calculation (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).

Consequently, can we assert that the USD will be valued at 145 JPY or higher at the close on August 9th, 2024? This will be determined based on the USD/JPY closing rate recorded for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents? (b) Will USD be worth >= 145 JPY (yen) at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) Market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance. Will USD be worth >= 145 JPY (yen) at close on August 9th, 2024?

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Will Trump receive at least 3% more support from Manifold respondents when opposed by Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat? (b) Will the value of USD reach or exceed 145 JPY (yen) at the closing on August 9th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while another asks for a vote for a generic Democrat. Public sentiment polls consistently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat hypothetically considered either leads or is within the margin of error. This market will conclude with a YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll is 3% or more greater than in the second poll upon their closure. The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus that for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, it is NO.

(b) The market outcome will be based on the USD/JPY closing value listed for August 9th, 2024, on Yahoo! Finance. Will the USD be valued at 145 JPY (yen) or more at the close on August 9th, 2024?

question.title: Will Australia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Australia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Australia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Australia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Australia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If Australia fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Given Australia qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Latvia also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Australia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Latvia also qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Australia secures a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Latvia do the same?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Australia competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Will Latvia then also secure a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Latvia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the EBU as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Australia and Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Australia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Australia or Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Australia and Latvia set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Australia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Latvia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Australia or Latvia fails to qualify, the inquiry will be regarded as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is there a chance Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden withdraw or become unable to proceed in the race before the clock strikes midnight on July 20 Eastern Time, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Conditional on Biden dropping out before July 20, will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Kamala Harris announce her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. Resolves NO if Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate. The pick must be confirmed by Kamala Harris herself.

para_P.title: If Biden withdraws prior to July 20, will Kamala Harris select either Kelly or Shapiro as her VP?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed in the race before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. Will Kamala Harris reveal her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro?

Criteria for meeting the condition: The condition is fulfilled if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed in the race before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves to YES if Kamala Harris declares her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. Resolves to NO if Kamala Harris names someone else as her running mate. The selection must be confirmed by Kamala Harris herself.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20 and (b) Kamala Harris picks either Kelly or Shapiro as VP before August 7?
question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (b) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by Kamala herself. The market resolves YES if both (a) and (b) occur as described. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20 and (b) Kamala Harris selects either Kelly or Shapiro as her vice-presidential candidate before August 7?
para_P.body: (a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. (b) Kamala Harris makes an announcement regarding her choice for running mate, specifically naming either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, before August 7th, as confirmed by Kamala herself. The market will indicate YES if both (a) and (b) take place as specified. If not, it will indicate NO.
