question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another debate for the Democratic party's presidential candidates going to take place?
para_P.body: Determines YES if a debate occurs among possible Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Determines NO in all other cases.

question.title: Given there is another Democratic party presidential debate, will Kamala Harris become president by Friday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. 

Then, will Kamala Harris be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Resolves NO otherwise. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also being used.

para_P.title: In the event of another Democratic presidential debate, will Kamala Harris assume the presidency by Friday?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: A debate occurs among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. 

Will Kamala Harris be officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET?

Criteria for resolution:
- For the condition: Resolves to YES if there is a debate among potential Democratic candidates before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves to NO if not.
- For the outcome: Resolves to YES if Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Resolves to NO otherwise. The primary source for resolution will be official information from the US government, supplemented by a consensus of reliable reporting.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention and (b) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.
(b) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No". The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of these events to take place: (a) a Democratic party presidential debate happens prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention and (b) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered TRUE if there is a debate involving potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be deemed FALSE otherwise.
(b) This market will be marked as "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If not, it will be marked as "No". The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, supplemented by a consensus from credible news sources.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Glenn Youngkin going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be evaluated as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional candidates may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, is it true that Chris Christie is also selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria: 
- Glenn Youngkin is the nominee if he is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
- Chris Christie is the nominee if he is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Note: Only one individual can be the nominee. If Glenn Youngkin is the nominee, Chris Christie cannot also be the nominee, and vice versa.

para_P.title: If Glenn Youngkin becomes the Republican nominee, is it possible for Chris Christie to also be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following statement holds: Glenn Youngkin is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, can we say that Chris Christie is also appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Criteria for resolution: 
- Glenn Youngkin is considered the nominee if he is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
- Chris Christie is considered the nominee if he is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Important note: There can only be one nominee. If Glenn Youngkin is the nominee, then Chris Christie cannot be the nominee, and vice versa.

question.title: Will both Glenn Youngkin and Chris Christie be the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Glenn Youngkin and Chris Christie are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other combinations of candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Are Glenn Youngkin and Chris Christie both going to be the Republican candidates for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin and Chris Christie are both chosen as the Republican nominees by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other combination of candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional candidates may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; the outcome is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This question considers the condition where Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, as reported by 538 and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. 

Given this condition, the question then asks whether Vivek Ramaswamy will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the election day itself.

para_P.title: Assuming Trump's advantage over Biden is between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will Vivek Ramaswamy be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

A lead value above zero indicates Trump is ahead, whereas a value below zero indicates Biden is leading.

Under this condition, the question then inquires whether Vivek Ramaswamy will be nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The outcome is determined by the decision of the delegates at the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is nominated on the election day itself.

(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate occurs among the potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO in all other cases.

question.title: Conditional on there being another Democratic party presidential debate, if Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Given this, if President Joe Biden drops out, will a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is a debate as described. Resolves NO otherwise.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the media coverage condition is met. Resolves NO if Biden drops out but the condition is not met. Resolves N/A if Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: If there is another debate for the Democratic party presidential candidates, will a reputable news organization report on Joe Biden's withdrawal at least 6 hours prior to his official announcement?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: There is a debate among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) leading up to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. In this context, if President Joe Biden decides to withdraw, will a major and trustworthy news organization like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provide coverage of his withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before Biden makes his official announcement through a letter, speech, etc.?

Criteria for resolving the condition: Resolves to YES if the debate occurs as described. Resolves to NO if it does not. 
Criteria for resolving the outcome: Resolves to YES if the media coverage condition is satisfied. Resolves to NO if Biden withdraws but the condition is not satisfied. Resolves to N/A if Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Another Democratic party presidential debate takes place (b) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) There will be another presidential debate among Democratic candidates (b) If Joe Biden withdraws, a credible news organization will report on it at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if a debate occurs among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be marked as NO otherwise.

(b) This question will be marked as YES if a major, trustworthy news outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on Biden's withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his departure through a letter, speech, etc.

Reports from local news, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not be adequate.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not step down before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Ted Cruz being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This resolves as Yes if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If no such statement is made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

para_P.title: Assuming Ted Cruz becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Imagine that Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. In that case, will Joe Biden publicly announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Criteria for the condition to be met: This will be considered Yes if Ted Cruz is indeed chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will lead to a No resolution.

Criteria for the outcome: This will resolve as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement indicating that he will not pursue nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be straightforward and definitive. If such a statement is not made by the specified deadline, this will resolve as No.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

For this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question will be answered with Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should leave no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Suppose the following is true: Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, is it true that Biden will drop out or otherwise be unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time? If so, the outcome resolves to YES; otherwise, it resolves to NO.

question.body:

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other inquires about a generic Democrat on the same ballot.

Public opinion surveys repeatedly indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats surveyed in similar hypothetical scenarios are either ahead or within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants reflect the broader public opinion?

This market will be deemed YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result of the first poll's formula minus the second poll's formula is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll invites Manifold respondents to cast their votes for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a generic Democrat on a similar hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump by a significant margin, yet every other Democrat considered in these hypothetical scenarios either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold respondents indicative of the broader public opinion?

This market will confirm YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater when both polls conclude.

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the result of the first poll's formula minus the second poll's formula is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

Assuming the stipulated condition is satisfied: Trump secures at least 3% more support from Manifold respondents when matched against Biden rather than a generic Democrat. In that case, will Donald Trump take the stand at the hush money trial?

This question will be resolved as Yes if reliable sources confirm that Donald Trump has provided testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the trial related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the US Core CPI will rise over 0.1% from June to July?
para_P.body:
This will be confirmed as YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% in comparison to June 2024.

The resolution data will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) value.

question.title: Given the US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value. Then, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024? This resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: If the US Core CPI rises by over 0.1% in July, will Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% when compared to June 2024. The resolution will be based on data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) figure. Consequently, will Biden be considered incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024? This will be resolved as YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other applicable authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024 (b) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context for (b): GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The US Core CPI rises by over 0.1% month-over-month in July 2024, and (b) Biden is deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data used for resolution will be found at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and must utilize the precise (not rounded) figure.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially assert that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context for (b): A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to use the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, the market will resolve with a no.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves to yes if Biden drops out or is unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question resolves "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. It strictly pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for legal battles, appeals, or reversals after this date.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, will Donald Trump face removal or prohibition from the primary election ballot in any state of the U.S. according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario holds: Joe Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. Then, is it accurate to say that Donald Trump will be removed or prohibited from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position as of July 15, 2024, under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Criteria for resolution regarding the condition: Resolves to yes if Biden withdraws or is unable to continue the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20.

Criteria for resolution regarding the outcome: Resolves "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or prohibited from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or prohibition must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media outlets. The question resolves "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled as of July 15, 2024. This strictly relates to the situation as of July 15, 2024, and does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or reversals that may occur after this date.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body: (a) This condition will be met if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) This condition will be met if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Biden exits the race before July 20, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) This condition will be satisfied if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed with the campaign before July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. (b) This condition will be satisfied if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. The question will be considered "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may take place after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that as of July 15 he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

If either Poland or Ireland fails to qualify, the inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Scotland will conduct an officially recognized referendum on its independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Scotland carries out a referendum concerning its independence from the United Kingdom before the date of May 3, 2024. This referendum can be classified as an "advisory" referendum; it is not required for the referendum to possess any legally binding authority.

A referendum will not be regarded as resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum if the UK government has refused to grant permission for the vote, nor by a vote arranged by civil society organizations. It is essential that the referendum is recognized as having the approval of the London government.

question.title: Given Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15?

Condition: Scotland must hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be advisory but must not be a "wildcat" or "Catalan" style referendum without UK government consent.

Outcome: Resolves YES if the linked market (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has at least 377 traders before it closes on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not be accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** outcome, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any doubt regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of acceptance.

Then, is it true that on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any category indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any similar categories indicating Russian control?

The resolution criteria for the outcome are as follows: The question resolves as YES if the location is assessed to be under Russian control as per the ISW map categories. It resolves as NO if the location is not under Russian control, indicated by categories such as Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, or any similar categories indicating Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian control.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will Russia have authority over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario: Prior to July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement that he will neither seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. This announcement must be explicit and definitive, allowing no possibility of acceptance.

The question is whether, on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as being under any classification suggesting Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any comparable categories denoting Russian authority?

The criteria for determining the outcome are as follows: The question will be answered YES if the location is classified as under Russian control according to the ISW map categories. It will be answered NO if the location is not under Russian control, as indicated by categories such as Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, or any similar classifications suggesting Ukrainian control or absence of Russian control.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (b) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to take place: (a) Joe Biden will publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (b) Russia will have taken control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the Democratic nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be unequivocal and definitive: it must eliminate any doubt that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the question will resolve as **No**.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when checked by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any of the following classifications:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other classifications established by ISW that signify Russian control of the area

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not categorized as under Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other classifications created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: In the event that Joe Biden withdraws, will a reputable news source report on the situation no less than 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be considered YES if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement of withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or remarks from individual users on Manifold will not qualify.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw prior to the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out and a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance, will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out, and a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Note that local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump Jr. will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden withdraws from the race and a trustworthy news source reports this at least 6 hours prior, will Donald Trump Jr. become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario holds: Joe Biden decides to withdraw, and a major and credible news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement regarding his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc. It is important to note that coverage from local news, conspiracy websites, or remarks by individual users on Manifold will not be adequate. This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

Under these circumstances, is it accurate to say that Donald Trump Jr. will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will be confirmed as Yes if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be confirmed as No. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently in the spotlight; additional options may emerge in the future. The outcome is strictly based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance, AND (2) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) This resolves YES if a major and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout. This will be resolved as N/A if Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(2) This resolves YES if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the election day.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) A trustworthy news source reports on Joe Biden's withdrawal at least 6 hours prior, should he decide to step down, AND (2) Donald Trump Jr. secures the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) This will be considered YES if a prominent and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides coverage on Joe Biden's withdrawal with unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he makes his official announcement. This will be marked as N/A if Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

(2) This will be marked as YES if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The determination is based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is nominated on election day.

question.title: Will Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Inflection will release a public report detailing the outcomes of external red-teaming of their models for safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Inflection, this inquiry will be deemed **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they make available a *public* report that presents the findings from an *external* party assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Conditional on Inflection publishing a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Inflection publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024. 

Resolution criteria for this condition: For Inflection, this resolves as YES if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Given this, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for this question: The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and NO otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it). If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain demographics, this will still resolve positively if at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the service is substantially the same.

para_P.title: If Inflection releases a report detailing the outcomes of external safety evaluations of their models by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union on that same date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Inflection issues a public report containing results from an independent assessment of the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024. 

Criteria for resolving this condition: For Inflection, this is considered YES if, by June 30, 2024, they release a public report with findings from an external evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

With this in mind, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Criteria for resolving this question: The inquiry is answered YES if ChatGPT is accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and NO otherwise. "Accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN (potentially requiring payment). If it is not available in specific EU countries, or to certain groups, it will still be considered a positive outcome if more than 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" refers to the overall web platform for engaging with GPT models, and is considered positively if the service remains largely unchanged.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Inflection publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) Inflection releases a report detailing the results from an external assessment of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is accessible to the general public in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Inflection, this question will be answered as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report containing the findings from an *external* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The question will be resolved as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

The term "accessible to the general public" here indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (possibly with a subscription fee). If it is not available in certain EU nations (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or not available to (for instance) minors, it will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" in this context refers to the main web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be positively resolved if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Francis Suarez going to be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to those candidates currently discussed; additional candidates may emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is made solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Francis Suarez being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not influenced by any other candidates or options.

Given this, will Joe Biden have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024? The resolution will be based on the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the blue and red trend lines for July 19. If Biden is projected as the favorite, the answer is YES. If Trump is projected as the favorite, the answer is NO. If both have equal odds, the resolution is 50-50. If no data is available for July 19, the nearest previous figures will be used.

para_P.title: Assuming Francis Suarez becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner this Friday?
para_P.body:
Let’s assume that Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not swayed by any other candidates or alternatives.

In this scenario, will Joe Biden be assessed as having a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024? The conclusion will rely on FiveThirtyEight's presidential election forecast for 2024, particularly the blue and red trend lines for July 19. If Biden is shown as the frontrunner, the answer is YES. If Trump is shown as the frontrunner, the answer is NO. If both candidates are shown to have equal chances, the outcome is 50-50. If there is no data available for July 19, the closest preceding data will be utilized.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) and not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

para_P.title: Is Francis Suarez going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Francis Suarez is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) and not by who is declared the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the figures shown by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. If Biden and Trump are projected to have equal chances, this market will resolve 50-50. If there are no data points for July 19 available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest prior figures to July 19.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will the opening weekend revenue for "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpass the combined earnings of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the opening weekend revenue for **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) exceeds $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office revenues for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Given "Deadpool & Wolverine" domestic box office opening exceeds the combined openings of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine", will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" is higher than the combined domestic box office openings of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), which is $185,548,391 in total, as reported by Boxofficemojo.

Given this condition, will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: "Deadpool & Wolverine" must have a domestic box office opening higher than $185,548,391.
- For the outcome: "Trap" must receive a B CinemaScore or higher to resolve YES, and a B- or lower to resolve NO. If no CinemaScore is reported, it resolves N/A.

Context:
- "Trap" is directed by M. Night Shyamalan, known for films like "Split" (B+), "Glass" (B), "Old" (C+), and "Knock at the Cabin" (C).

para_P.title: If the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpasses the total openings of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine", will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" achieve a CinemaScore of B or higher?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceeds the total domestic box office openings of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), which amounts to $185,548,391 in total, according to Boxofficemojo.

Resolution criteria:

- For the result: "Trap" must secure a B CinemaScore or above to resolve YES, and a B- or lower to resolve NO. If a CinemaScore is not available, it resolves N/A.

Context:
- "Trap" is helmed by M. Night Shyamalan, recognized for films such as "Split" (B+), "Glass" (B), "Old" (C+), and "Knock at the Cabin" (C).

question.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

(b) This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if they fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Given Malta qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Serbia also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria for Serbia: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Malta secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, does that mean Serbia will also secure a spot?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Malta competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, does this imply that Serbia will also secure a place in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?

Criteria for determining Serbia's qualification: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Serbia competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, it will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will both Malta and Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Malta and Serbia participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Malta and Serbia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both Malta and Serbia take part in a Semi-final and are confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured their spots in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not make it, the answer will be **No**.
