question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the gap between Trump and Biden in 538's national polling average exceed 2 but be at most 3?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the margin by which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden as per 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates Trump's advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the recorded value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by the national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Then, is it true that the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? This will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden falls between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index show an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Donald Trump has an advantage over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average. This is derived from the national polling average related to the 2024 presidential election as shown on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this inquiry, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden.

Then, can we ascertain that the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be reported as higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? This determination will be made based on data from the St. Louis Fed. The figure for July 20, 2024 must exceed the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average and (b) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to 538's national polling average, and will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) show an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved by the lead that Donald Trump holds over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as documented on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the value recorded for that date shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for this question.

(b) The resolution of this question will depend on the data provided by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure reported for July 20, 2024, must exceed the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tucker Carlson going to be the nominee for the Republican Party in the 2024 Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States. If a different candidate is chosen, the answer will be **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently recognized; additional candidates may emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who holds the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 election; the determination is exclusively based on who is picked by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question examines the scenario where Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. In this situation, will President Biden drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Tucker Carlson must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will not meet the condition.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry explores the possibility that Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. In this context, will President Biden decide to withdraw or be incapable of continuing his campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time?

Criteria for determining the condition: Tucker Carlson must be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The selection of any other candidate will not satisfy this condition.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves to YES if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. Resolves to NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. If either condition is not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

Details:
(a) Tucker Carlson must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.
(b) Biden must drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: (a) Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed with the race before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. If either criterion is not satisfied, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

Details:
(a) Tucker Carlson must be chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant.
(b) Biden must withdraw or be unable to continue the race before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the associated market to reach a total of 377 traders by the close of July 15? (78 additional traders needed!)

Apologies to my incredibly devoted followers, I've found myself caught up in some market activities, prompting me to create this market.

(https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)The outcome will be YES if the market linked above achieves 377 traders prior to the market's conclusion (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will be NO if it does not.

question.title: Conditional on the linked market getting at least 377 traders by end of July 15, will ISS advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body:
Sorry to my extremely loyal followers, I’ve become embroiled in some market shenanigans, so I’m making this market.

(https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) Resolves YES if the market embedded above has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

Suppose the following is true: The linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15. Then, will ISS advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?

para_P.title: If the connected market attracts a minimum of 377 traders by the conclusion of July 15, will ISS recommend that Tesla shareholders oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation plan or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
para_P.body:
I apologize to my very dedicated followers; I have found myself caught up in some market activities, which is why I am creating this market.

(https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) This will resolve as YES if the market linked above reaches 377 traders before it closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve as NO in all other cases.

The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's compensation package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR to oppose the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

Assuming the following is accurate: The connected market attracts at least 377 traders by the end of July 15. Then, will ISS recommend that Tesla shareholders vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation plan or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, and (b) ISS advises Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's $57 billion package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the market embedded in the following link has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time): https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) The question resolves YES if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) The linked market attracts a minimum of 377 participants by the close of July 15, and (b) ISS recommends that Tesla shareholders oppose either Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation deal or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if the market referenced in the following link has at least 377 participants before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time): https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g. It will be marked as NO if not.

(b) The question will be marked as YES if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's compensation package during the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the board of directors at Tesla. If not, the question will be marked as NO.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be determined to be incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Given Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will he die before Saturday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Given this, will there be an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? Resolves YES if such an announcement occurs before this deadline. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: If Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, will he pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario is accurate: The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office," resulting in the Vice President taking on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

In light of this, will there be a formal declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th? This will resolve to YES if such a declaration is made before this cutoff. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(b) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will happen: (a) Biden is officially declared unable to perform his presidential duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, and (b) Joe Biden passes away before the end of the day on Saturday, July 26th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered TRUE if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded. Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

(b) This will be considered TRUE if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. If not, it will be considered FALSE.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value surpass Apple's on July 17, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with a Yes if, on July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple, based on Companies Market Cap, as verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: If Nvidia's market cap exceeds Apple's on July 17, 2024, will Donald Trump be removed from any primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's, as verified by Companies Market Cap and checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). Then, is it true that Donald Trump will have been removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Nvidia's market cap must be greater than Apple's on July 17, 2024, according to Companies Market Cap.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Donald Trump must have been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The resolution does not consider legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals occurring after July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: Should Nvidia's market capitalization surpass that of Apple on July 17, 2024, will Donald Trump be disqualified from any primary ballot according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market cap is confirmed to be greater than that of Apple, as per Companies Market Cap and verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). Then, is it accurate to state that Donald Trump will have been disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?

Criteria for assessing the condition: Nvidia's market capitalization must exceed Apple's on July 17, 2024, according to Companies Market Cap.

Criteria for assessing the outcome: Donald Trump must have been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be substantiated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reputable media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be accepted. The resolution will not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or reversals that occur after July 15, 2024.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's and will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question resolves Yes if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if either of these conditions is not met. Note: For the second condition, the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after July 15, 2024. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market cap exceed Apple's, and will Donald Trump be disqualified or prohibited from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or prohibited from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or prohibition must be substantiated by official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documentation, or reliable media reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial announcements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will result in a "No" if either of these criteria is unmet. Note: Regarding the second criterion, this question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may take place after July 15, 2024. It strictly focuses on whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the specified criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prohibited from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prohibited from any ballot, the inquiry resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, then the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Given the Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, i.e., they have a brokered convention.

Resolution criteria for the condition: This resolves as **Yes** if more than one round of voting is needed, and **No** if only one ballot is required.

Then, is it true that 10 or more Democratic Senators will call for Biden to drop out before July 20?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as **Yes** if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: If the Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024, will at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: The Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, meaning they are having a brokered convention.

Criteria for determining the condition: This is resolved as **Yes** if multiple rounds of voting are necessary, and **No** if only a single ballot suffices.

Now, is it accurate that at least 10 Democratic Senators will urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this resolves as **No**.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the resolution source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this resolves as **Yes**. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**. The resolution source is https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen: (a) Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024 (b) At least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024: This will be marked as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this will be marked as **No**.

(b) At least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20: If, at any time before midnight on July 20 Central Time, the resolution source indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators are calling for Biden to step down, this will be marked as **Yes**. If not, it will be marked as **No**. The resolution source is https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

para_P.title: Is it possible that 24 or more world records will be set during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the total count of world records established at the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or exceeds it.

question.title: Conditional on at least 24 world records being broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will France place in the Top 5?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between the number of world records broken and France's performance at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Suppose the following is true: At least 24 world records are broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, will France place in the top 5 in the medal table?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if 24 or more world records are broken during the Paris Olympics.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The outcome resolves positively if France places in the top 5 in the medal table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is determined by the total number of medals, ordered by the number of gold, then silver, then bronze medals. If the Olympics do not take place, the outcome resolves ambiguously.

para_P.title: If a minimum of 24 world records are set during the 2024 Paris Olympics, will France achieve a Top 5 finish?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines how the number of world records established correlates with France's success at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Assuming the following holds true: A minimum of 24 world records are established at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Will France then secure a position within the top 5 of the medal standings?

Criteria for the condition's fulfillment: The condition is satisfied if 24 or more world records are established during the Paris Olympics.

Criteria for the outcome's resolution: The outcome is considered affirmative if France secures a top 5 position in the medal standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal standings are determined by the overall count of medals, ranked first by gold, then silver, and finally bronze medals. If the Olympics do not occur, the outcome remains uncertain.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) At least 24 world records are broken (b) France places in the Top 5?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) The number of world records broken is 24 or greater. (2) France places in the top 5 in the medal table, which is calculated by ordering the total number of medals won by each participating country by: (a) Number of Gold Medals, (b) Number of Silver Medals (in case of a tie in Gold), and (c) Number of Bronze Medals (in case of a tie in Silver). The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events expected to take place at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A minimum of 24 world records will be shattered (b) France finishes in the Top 5?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) The total number of world records broken is at least 24. (2) France secures a position in the top 5 of the medal standings, which is determined by ranking the total medals earned by each participating nation based on: (a) Total Gold Medals, (b) Total Silver Medals (in the event of a Gold tie), and (c) Total Bronze Medals (in the event of a Silver tie). The question will be left uncertain if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves identically to the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should leave no ambiguity regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Further details and context can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will be automatically applied to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the result is known and clear. Please feel free to contact @jskf for early resolution requests or to report issues.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will the US government end its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, will the US Department of Commerce officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024? This question resolves as **Yes** if such termination occurs before August 3, 2024, and **No** if it does not.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden makes a public declaration prior to July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will the US government discontinue its contract with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for a second term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear-cut and definitive, allowing no possibility for Biden to accept the nomination.

Then, will the US Department of Commerce formally end or phase out its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign concerning Verisign's oversight of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) prior to August 3, 2024? This question is answered with **Yes** if such an ending occurs before August 3, 2024, and **No** if it does not.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (2) The US government will end its agreement allowing Verisign to manage the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek or accept the nomination for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination. If no such statement is made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(2) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if the US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com TLD before August 3, 2024. If this does not happen, this resolves as No.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) Joe Biden will declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, and (2) The US government will terminate its contract permitting Verisign to oversee the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden make a declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This is considered Yes if Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not seek or accept the nomination for another term as President in the 2024 election. The statement must be explicit and definitive, leaving no possibility of accepting the nomination. If no such announcement is made by the deadline, this will be No.

(2) Will the US government conclude its agreement that allows Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This will be Yes if the US Department of Commerce formally ends or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign regarding Verisign's management of the .com TLD before August 3, 2024. If this does not occur, this will be No.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Given Malta qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Cyprus also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Given this, will Cyprus also qualify for the Grand Final?

Resolution criteria for Cyprus: The question will resolve as **Yes** if Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Cyprus does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Malta secures a spot in the Grand Final for Eurovision 2024, will Cyprus achieve the same?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In light of this, will Cyprus also secure a spot in the Grand Final?

Criteria for determining Cyprus's qualification: The question will be answered with **Yes** if Cyprus competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Cyprus does not qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Malta and Cyprus qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Malta and Cyprus participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Malta or Cyprus does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Malta and Cyprus set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both Malta and Cyprus take part in their designated Semi-finals and are confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Malta or Cyprus fails to qualify, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the United States to secure gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This will be considered true if Team USA achieves victory and wins both gold medals. It will be deemed false if either the men's or women's team finishes in a position other than first place.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden fall between 2 and 4, inclusive, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by accessing the chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, will the linked market have at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024? The market resolves YES if it reaches 377 traders before market close on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time, and NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, will the associated market attract a minimum of 377 participants by the close of July 15?
para_P.body:

This information can be verified by checking the chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive number signifies a lead for Trump.

Then, will the associated market have at least 377 participants by the end of July 15, 2024? The market will resolve to YES if it reaches 377 participants before the market closes at 11:59 PM Pacific Time on July 15, and NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Norway qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Norway going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Norway takes part in a Semi-final and is formally recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Should Norway fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Norway qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Switzerland qualify as well?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:
1. Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.
2. Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

If Norway does not qualify, this question resolves as N/A. If Norway qualifies but Switzerland does not, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: If Norway secures a spot in the Grand Final for Eurovision 2024, will Switzerland also make it?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:
1. Norway competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.
2. Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Should Norway fail to qualify, this question will be resolved as N/A. If Norway qualifies but Switzerland does not, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will both Norway and Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Norway and Switzerland participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Norway or Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Norway and Switzerland both set to advance to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both Norway and Switzerland take part in their individual Semi-finals and are officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Should either Norway or Switzerland fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

para_P.body:

- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian dominance over the area



The inquiry will be marked as **No** if the site is not categorized under any of the classifications denoting Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Advances in the Last 24 Hours

- Asserted Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Ukrainian control over the site or a lack of Russian dominance over the site.

question.title: Given Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from any U.S. state primary ballot for federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:

Then, is the following also true on July 15, 2024: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This would be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date.

Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution. The inquiry specifically concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024, and does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may happen after the specified date.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: Will the Pandemic Accord receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Pandemic Accord is sanctioned through a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, based on information from reliable sources.

question.title: Conditional on the Pandemic Agreement being approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources. 

Then, will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Additionally, Metaculus must verify that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as YES. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If the Pandemic Agreement is ratified at the World Health Assembly in May 2024, will OpenAI make a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for disclosing public risks" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Pandemic Agreement is ratified during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), based on information from reliable sources. 

Then, will OpenAI make a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for disclosing public risks" before July 1, 2024? 

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves YES if, prior to July 1, 2024, OpenAI makes a public commitment to the "no retaliation for disclosing public risks" principle through a statement from the organization or a representative, such as Sam Altman. This statement can be formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a comment in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must reflect a heightened commitment to the principle compared to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was issued; it cannot simply repeat that, for instance, "we already foster a culture of open criticism". Furthermore, Metaculus must confirm that the organization has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may contact selected signatories or endorsers to gauge their satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as strong as "this was a positive initial step" for this question to be resolved as YES. If this condition is not fulfilled, it resolves N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly and (b) OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following are true:

1. During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

2. Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Additionally, Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following events will take place: (a) the Pandemic Agreement receives approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024, and (b) OpenAI makes a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the subsequent conditions are satisfied:

1. The Pandemic Agreement is voted on and approved during the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, as reported by reliable sources.

2. OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024, through a statement from the organization or a spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. This statement can be formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a quote in an interview). The communication from OpenAI must denote a heightened commitment to the principle compared to the period when the righttowarn.ai statement was released; it cannot simply restate that, for instance, "we already foster a culture of open criticism." Furthermore, Metaculus must confirm that the organization has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may contact certain signatories or endorsers to evaluate their level of contentment with OpenAI's commitment. Statements need to be at least as strong as "this was a good first step" for this inquiry to be resolved as **Yes**.

Suppose the following is true: Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 per share on any day before 7/31. Then, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The market resolves to YES if NVDA closes below $100 on any day before 7/31.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be taken from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: If Nvidia ends the day below $100 per share prior to 7/31, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI rise by over 0.1% in July?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) finishes a trading day below $100 per share on any date before 7/31. Then, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI experience an increase greater than 0.1% in July?

Criteria for the condition's resolution: The market will determine a YES if NVDA closes below $100 on any day leading up to 7/31.

Criteria for the outcome's resolution: It will resolve to YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase exceeding 0.1% when compared to June 2024. The resolution data will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 per share on any day before 7/31 and (b) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
(a) This resolves to YES if NVDA closes below $100 on any day before 7/31.
(b) This resolves to YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) has a closing price of under $100 per share on any day prior to July 31, and (b) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI rises by more than 0.1% in July?
para_P.body:
(a) This is confirmed with a YES if NVDA's closing price is below $100 on any day before July 31.
(b) This is confirmed with a YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% when compared to June 2024, according to the exact figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

question.title: Given the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

para_P.title: If the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index shows an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Donald Trump be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be deemed NO.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden dying before Saturday, will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before the end of Friday, July 26th, as officially announced. Then, will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: If Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday, will the leader of the Secret Service step down in the following 90 days?
para_P.body: Imagine that the following scenario occurs: Joe Biden passes away before the end of Friday, July 26th, as officially declared. In that case, will Kimberly Cheatle, who is the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be dismissed, or for any other reason cease to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer serves as the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden pass away prior to Saturday, and will the head of the Secret Service step down in the next 90 days?
para_P.body: This resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) There is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, and (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the U.S. Secret Service Director, resigns, is dismissed, or for any reason ceases to hold the position of director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. If not, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a resolution of **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Ted Cruz is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is the nominee.

Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This resolves based on the reported value on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, and we are interested in whether this value is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4.

para_P.title: Assuming Ted Cruz becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 3 but be 4 or less on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Let’s say Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This will be marked as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is indeed the candidate.

Now, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden surpass 3 but not exceed 4 on July 15, 2024, based on the national polling average from 538? This will be determined by the value shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, which will be accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, and we are looking to see if this figure is greater than 3 and 4 or below.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Ted Cruz becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 3 but at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This choice is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who is announced as the nominee on election day.

(b) According to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is reported to be greater than 3 and not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, as viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves the same as the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be marked as No.

Further details and context can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the result is known and clear. You may contact @jskf to request early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President for another term in the 2024 cycle. This announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this, will there be a debate between potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention? Resolves YES if such a debate occurs, and NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden declares before July 15, 2024, that he won't pursue the Democratic nomination, will there be an additional debate for Democratic presidential candidates?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario is accurate: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President for another term in the 2024 election cycle. This statement must be clear and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden might accept the nomination.

In light of this, will there be a debate involving potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention? Resolves YES if such a debate takes place, and NO if it does not.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. Resolves as No otherwise.

(2) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?

This resolves as Yes if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves as No otherwise.

The combined question resolves as Yes if both (1) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President and (2) there is another Democratic party presidential debate. Resolves as No otherwise.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, and will there be an additional Democratic party presidential debate?
para_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official declaration that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be clear and definitive, leaving no ambiguity that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. Resolves as No otherwise.

(2) Will there be an additional Democratic party presidential debate?

This resolves as Yes if there is a debate among potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves as No otherwise.

The combined question resolves as Yes if both (1) Joe Biden declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President and (2) there is an additional Democratic party presidential debate. Resolves as No otherwise.
