question.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Google DeepMind will release a report detailing findings from external safety evaluations of their models by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Google DeepMind issues a *public* report presenting the results from an *external* red-teaming assessment of one of their AI models' safety.

question.title: Conditional on Google DeepMind publishing a report with results from external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on that date?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By June 30, 2024, Google DeepMind publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Given this, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if Google DeepMind publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, meaning that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. It still resolves positively if unavailable in certain EU countries or to certain groups, as long as >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the name or website has changed but the service remains substantially the same.

para_P.title: If Google DeepMind releases a report featuring findings from external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the public in the EU on that date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By June 30, 2024, Google DeepMind issues a public report containing results from an external entity that has red-teamed the safety of one of their AI models. In light of this, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be publicly accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Criteria for meeting the condition: The condition is satisfied if Google DeepMind releases a public report with findings from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

Criteria for determining the outcome: The question is answered with YES if ChatGPT is available to the public in the EU on June 30, 2024, indicating that individuals in the EU can access it without needing a VPN, potentially requiring payment. It also resolves positively if it is unavailable in specific EU countries or to certain demographics, provided that over 50% of the population has access. "ChatGPT" denotes the general web interface for engaging with GPT models, and the answer remains positive if the name or website changes but the service is fundamentally the same.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) a report detailing the findings from external safety assessments of Google DeepMind's models is released, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is accessible to users within the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question will be marked as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report containing the findings from an *outside* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this question will be marked as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is available to the general public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

Here, "available to the general public" indicates that individuals in the EU can access it without the need for a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as was seen in Italy in early 2023), or restricted to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that over 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the main web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be viewed positively if the branding or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally unchanged (allowing users to submit queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the gap between Trump's and Biden's polling be more than 2 but at most 3 according to 538's national average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in polling between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as per 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Given Trump’s lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Biden have a 45+ minute in-person interview before end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by accessing the national polling average chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? 

For Biden's interview to count, it must be an in-person interview with at least 45 minutes of new footage of him being interviewed. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not count. Appearances on podcasts, late-night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 Minutes do qualify, provided there is at least 45 minutes of interview footage. If no such interview is released by the end of July, the outcome is NO.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, will Biden conduct a 45+ minute face-to-face interview before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and at most 3, according to 538's national polling average. This can be verified by checking the national polling average chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive figure reflects a Trump lead.

Then, can we confirm that Joe Biden will engage in a face-to-face interview or recorded conversation lasting at least 45 minutes before July 31, 2024? 

To qualify as Biden's interview, it must be an in-person session featuring a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of him being questioned. Events like press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not qualify. However, appearances on podcasts, late-night shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes do count, as long as there is at least 45 minutes of interview footage. If no such interview is made public by the end of July, the result is NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (a) Will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Will Joe Biden engage in a face-to-face interview/conversation on camera lasting 45 minutes or longer, prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is leading. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

(b) The latest qualifying interview was Biden's guest appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

Should Biden participate in another such face-to-face interview for at least 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. If no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, this market will resolve to NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video might only contain 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, and thus would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have all featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

A comprehensive list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts can be found here.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will any of the specified Israeli leaders have arrest warrants issued by the International Criminal Court prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
The answer to this question will be **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below before July 1, 2024. If no warrants are issued, the answer will be **No**.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Conditional on the ICC issuing arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court issues an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli leaders: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. Then, will a terrorist attack occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The attack must be described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The question resolves as No if the above does not happen.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If the ICC issues arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials prior to July 1, 2024, will there be a terrorist incident in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court issues an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli officials: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. In that case, will a terrorist incident take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

Criteria for meeting the condition: The condition is satisfied if the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the mentioned Israeli officials before July 1, 2024.

Criteria for determining the outcome: The question is answered with Yes if a terrorist incident in Metropolitan France causes injury and/or death to at least one individual, other than the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The incident must be classified as such by any French state agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The question is answered with No if the above does not occur.

If the condition is not satisfied, the question is answered as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024 (b) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

(b) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) The International Criminal Court issues arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials prior to July 1, 2024 (b) A terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below. It will be answered with **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

(b) The inquiry will be answered with Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injury and/or death of at least one individual, other than the terrorist(s), between, and including, the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The inquiry will be answered with No if the above does not occur.

An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a resolution of **No**. This question is open to the addition of other candidates beyond those currently listed.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If this condition is met, we then inquire whether credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. 

Resolution criterion for the condition: Resolves **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee. Resolves **No** otherwise.

Resolution criterion for the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified at the trial, whether in person or remotely. Resolves **No** otherwise.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Will Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump provide testimony in the hush money case?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation in which Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Given this premise, we then seek to determine whether reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or virtually, at the trial related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels. 

Criteria for determining the condition: Resolves **Yes** if Will Hurd is appointed by the Republican National Convention delegates as the candidate. Resolves **No** if not. 

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if trustworthy sources report that Donald Trump has testified at the trial, regardless of whether it was in person or remotely. Resolves **No** if not. 

If the initial condition is not satisfied, the question is resolved as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 

1. Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not influenced by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

If either of the above conditions is not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of these events will take place: (a) Will Hurd be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: 

1. Hurd is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is unaffected by who secures the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election.

2. Reliable sources confirm that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the trial related to the "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

Should either of these conditions fail to be fulfilled, this question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If they fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Given Malta qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Slovenia also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Slovenia also qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria for Slovenia: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If it does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Malta secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Slovenia achieve the same?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Slovenia also secure a spot in the Grand Final? 

Criteria for Slovenia's resolution: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Slovenia competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If it fails to qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both Malta and Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (1) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Malta or Slovenia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Malta and Slovenia set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Slovenia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Malta or Slovenia fails to qualify, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Tim Scott is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other contenders will result in a **No** answer. This question is not limited to the candidates currently recognized; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the outcome is solely based on who is picked by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Tim Scott is the Republican nominee, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means Tim Scott is the Republican nominee.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves No otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Resolves No if Donald Trump has a higher probability. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, resolves 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast.

para_P.title: Should Tim Scott become the Republican candidate, will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Tim Scott is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This indicates that Tim Scott is the Republican candidate.

Then, is it correct to say that Joe Biden will possess a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election prediction for July 19, 2024?

Criteria for determining the condition: Resolves Yes if Tim Scott is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves No otherwise.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves Yes if Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election prediction for July 19, 2024. Resolves No if Donald Trump has a greater chance. If Biden and Trump have the same odds, resolves 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast.

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If both conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**. 

For the first condition, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by the selection at the Republican National Convention.

For the second condition, the resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

para_P.title: Is Tim Scott going to be the GOP's candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (a) Tim Scott is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is exclusively based on the selection made by the Republican National Convention delegates. (b) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden possesses a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump. If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, the inquiry will conclude as **No**. 

Regarding the first criterion, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is determined solely by the outcome of the Republican National Convention. 

For the second criterion, the resolution will rely on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the values represented by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. Any changes in FiveThirtyEight's methodology for calculating these figures will not affect the resolution. If no data points for July 19 are accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest previous figures to July 19.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart for July 15, 2024, as reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, resulting in a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. This means a positive value between 3 and 4 points, inclusive, indicating a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Assuming Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 3 but no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, is Chris Christie going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Under this premise, will Chris Christie be chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention? This conclusion is determined solely by the decision of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, independent of who might be the nominee on the date of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 3 but no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, as per 538's national polling average, and (b) Chris Christie will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved as Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value was Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which equates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to those candidates currently mentioned; additional options may emerge in the future. The determination of this question is not based on who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly based on who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA party secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 elections for the European Parliament, and as **No** for all other results. If there is a tie in the number of seats between two groups, both sub-questions will be resolved as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media sources.

question.title: Conditional on Greens–EFA holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will GUE/NGL also hold the most seats?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both the Greens–EFA and GUE/NGL political groups hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If both groups are tied for seats, this resolves as **Yes**. 

Resolution criterion for Greens–EFA: Resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Resolution criterion for GUE/NGL: Resolves as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Assuming the Greens–EFA secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will GUE/NGL also achieve the highest number of seats?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both the Greens–EFA and GUE/NGL political factions secure the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. In the event of a tie in seats between the two groups, this will also resolve as **Yes**. 

Criteria for resolution regarding Greens–EFA: This will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction has the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, as confirmed by official announcements from the European Parliament or trustworthy media sources.

Criteria for resolution regarding GUE/NGL: This will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the greatest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official declarations from the European Parliament or reliable media outlets.

question.title: Will both the Greens–EFA and GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both the Greens–EFA political group and the GUE/NGL political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two or more groups are tied for the most seats and both Greens–EFA and GUE/NGL are among them, this question will resolve as **Yes**. The resolution will be based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: After the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will the Greens–EFA and GUE/NGL be the political groups with the highest number of seats?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the political group Greens–EFA and the political group GUE/NGL secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections. Should there be a tie for the most seats and both Greens–EFA and GUE/NGL are included in that tie, the answer will also be **Yes**. The conclusion will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for an athlete to secure multiple medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if any athlete achieves a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games.

question.title: Given an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where at least one athlete wins two or more medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Under this condition:

- The question resolves as **No** if women's teams from eight different National Olympic Committees (NOCs) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics:
  - Association football
  - 3×3 basketball
  - 5×5 basketball
  - Field hockey
  - Handball
  - Rugby sevens
  - Volleyball
  - Water polo.

- Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g., neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

para_P.title: If an athlete secures multiple medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the same country achieve victories in more than one women's team event at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation in which at least one athlete earns two or more medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics. In this context:

- The response will be **No** if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOCs) secure gold medals in these eight team events at the 2024 Paris Olympics:
  - Association football
  - 3×3 basketball
  - 5×5 basketball
  - Field hockey
  - Handball
  - Rugby sevens
  - Volleyball
  - Water polo.

- If not, then the same NOC must have won at least two of these competitions, leading to a **Yes** answer.

The question can be answered as soon as it is evident that one of these scenarios will occur (for instance, if neither team participating in the final of the last event has won any of the others).

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, and (b) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

(a) An athlete wins at least two medals for tennis.

(b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in at least two of the following women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. The question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win these eight team sports.

para_P.title: At the 2024 Paris Olympics, will there be both: (a) a tennis player who secures multiple medals, and (b) the same country achieving victories in more than one women's team event?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following scenarios occur during the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

(a) A tennis player earns at least two medals.

(b) The identical National Olympic Committee (NOC) claims gold in at least two of these women's team events: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. The response will be **No** if women's teams from eight distinct NOCs win in these eight team sports.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is there a chance Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden withdraw or be otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Chris Christie be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if Biden drops out before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, otherwise resolves No.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, otherwise resolves No.

para_P.title: If Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, will Chris Christie be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. Will Chris Christie be appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Criteria for the condition to resolve: Resolves to Yes if Biden withdraws before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time; otherwise, it resolves to No.
Criteria for the outcome to resolve: Resolves to Yes if Chris Christie is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election; otherwise, it resolves to No.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024 (b) Chris Christie is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024 midnight Eastern Time. (b) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, 2024 (b) Chris Christie becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: (a) Biden steps down or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, 2024. (b) Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, no matter who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tucker Carlson going to be the nominee for the Republican Party in the 2024 Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States. If any other candidate is chosen, it will conclude with a **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently announced; additional candidates may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 election is irrelevant; the determination is based solely on who the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) select.

question.title: Conditional on Tucker Carlson being the Republican nominee, will Francis Suarez also be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Given this, we are interested in whether Francis Suarez will also be selected as the nominee. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO otherwise.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO otherwise. 

Note: The Republican National Convention can only select one nominee for the presidential election, so if Tucker Carlson is the nominee, Francis Suarez cannot be. Therefore, if the condition is true, the outcome will resolve NO.

question.title: Given Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024?

Resolution criterion for the condition: Tucker Carlson must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criterion for the outcome: Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

If both conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is >3 and ≤4 on July 15, 2024, will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by the value reported on the chart for that date, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

Then, is it true that Larry Elder will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Larry Elder is selected as the nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. If any other candidate is selected, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 3 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, will Larry Elder be the Republican candidate?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 3 and at most 4 based on 538's national polling average. This information is derived from the data shown on the chart for that specific date, which was accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden.

In that case, is it accurate to say that Larry Elder will be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will be answered with YES if Larry Elder is nominated by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. If any other individual is nominated, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is reported as greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Larry Elder will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential election shows Donald Trump leading Joe Biden by a margin greater than 3 and up to 4 points on the chart dated July 15, 2024, as checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive margin reflects a lead for Trump.

(b) This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Larry Elder is chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. This determination relies entirely on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Les Républicains and the National Rally collaborate for the 2024 French legislative election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if an official coalition or electoral alliance is declared between Les Républicains and Rassemblement National prior to June 30, 2024, based on information from [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If there is no such declaration, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Given the Republicans Party of France forms an alliance with the National Rally, will the Prime Minister belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. Then, will the party of the Prime Minister of France be Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources?

para_P.title: If the Republicans Party in France establishes a partnership with the National Rally, will the Prime Minister's party be part of the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: An official announcement regarding an electoral coalition or alliance between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) is made before June 30, 2024, as reported by reliable sources. Will the Prime Minister of France's party be affiliated with Together on July 30th at 12:00 Central European Time, based on trustworthy information?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election, and (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. (b) The party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. If either condition is not met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) will establish a political coalition with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative elections, and (b) The Prime Minister of France is part of the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This question is answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) An electoral alliance or coalition agreement between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming French legislative election is officially declared before June 30, 2024, as reported by reliable sources. (b) On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the Prime Minister of France's party is Together, according to trustworthy sources. If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, this question is answered with **No**.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Francis Suarez going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Francis Suarez is chosen as the candidate by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is elected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Francis Suarez being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between the Republican and Democratic nomination processes for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Condition: Francis Suarez must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Outcome: The question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Assuming Francis Suarez is the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between the nomination processes of the Republican and Democratic parties regarding the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Condition: Francis Suarez must be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Outcome: The question is answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs to conduct more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then the answer is **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: (a) Francis Suarez will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who is on the ballot on the day of the election. (b) The Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024 if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) Francis Suarez becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: (a) Francis Suarez will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their nominee. This choice is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who appears on the election day ballot. (b) The Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024 if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate their candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not apply.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will he announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President. Note that Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

Then, will Joe Biden or his campaign make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle? To resolve as Yes, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.

para_P.title: Should Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, will he publicly declare by July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Prior to August 2024, the Vice President alongside a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that Biden is incapable of fulfilling the responsibilities of his office, resulting in the Vice President taking on the role of Acting President. It is important to note that Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, etc., or the invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not applicable.

In this scenario, will Joe Biden or his campaign issue a clear, public, and official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, confirming that he will not pursue and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for the presidency in the 2024 election? For the answer to be Yes, the announcement must be clear and definitive, with no possibility of accepting the nomination.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President: This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) Biden to be deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August 2024 and (b) Joe Biden to declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden to be deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August 2024: This will resolve as YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden to declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President: This will resolve as **Yes** if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official announcement stating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should leave no doubt that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
