The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Given that Kamala's chances of winning are predicted to rise according to Nate Silver's analysis, will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Kamala's chances of winning are projected to increase in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's analysis. This will resolve as YES if the Electoral College likelihood for Harris in Nate Silver's analysis exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will resolve as NO otherwise.

Now, is it accurate to say that Joe Biden will make a statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official announcement stating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive, with no implication that Biden might accept the nomination. If such an announcement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) According to Nate Silver's model, Kamala's chances of winning will rise in the coming week, and (b) Joe Biden will publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered YES if the likelihood of Harris winning in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) The resolution of this question will be **Yes** if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not pursue and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should leave no doubt that Biden will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they contend suppresses the crucial ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members remain significantly concerned about the prospects of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He did not confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if just a single ballot is necessary, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Democrats having a brokered convention in 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. In this context, we want to know if at least 20 House or Senate Democrats will sign a public letter opposing the Democratic National Committee's plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden early.

Resolution criteria for the condition: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: If Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024, will a minimum of 20 Democratic representatives in the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the early virtual nomination of Biden?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation in which the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the upcoming 2024 US presidential election. Within this framework, we seek to determine whether at least 20 Democratic representatives from the House or Senate will endorse a public letter opposing the Democratic National Committee's strategy to virtually nominate President Joe Biden ahead of time.

Criteria for evaluating the condition: The Democratic Party needs more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

Criteria for evaluating the outcome: Resolves to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is endorsed by at least 20 House members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Additionally, if multiple letters together have a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers, this would also be enough to resolve this market to YES. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market resolves to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this condition is not met.

(b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also meet this condition. If these criteria are not met by market close, this condition is not met.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) The Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024 (b) At least 20 Democratic House/Senate members publicly sign a letter against the plan to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
(a) The Democratic Party must have more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one vote is needed, then this requirement is not fulfilled.

(b) A public letter dissenting against the early nomination strategy is endorsed by at least 20 members from the House or Senate who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. Several such letters totaling at least 20 lawmakers' signatures would also satisfy this requirement. If these conditions are not met by market close, this requirement is not satisfied.

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Will a Woman be the Democratic Candidate for President in 2024?
para_P.body:
This will conclude with a “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidency in the 2024 election.

It will conclude with a “no” if the Democratic delegates choose a male candidate for the presidency in the 2024 election.

question.title: Given the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Woman, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Then, consider the following: Will the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics? This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as Yes.

para_P.title: If a Woman is Nominated as the Democratic Presidential Candidate in 2024, will the Same National Olympic Committee Secure Gold in Multiple Women's Team Sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Democratic delegates choose a woman as their presidential candidate for the 2024 election.

Then, reflect on this: Will the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) achieve victory in more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics? This question will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct NOCs claim gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have triumphed in at least two of these competitions, leading to a Yes answer.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman (b) The same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
(a) The question about the Democratic Presidential Nominee will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. It will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

(b) The question about the 2024 Olympics will resolve as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as Yes.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) A Woman will be the Democratic Presidential Nominee in 2024 (b) A single country will secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry regarding the Democratic Presidential Nominee will be considered “yes” once the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential election in 2024. It will be deemed “no” if a male candidate is selected by the Democratic delegates for the 2024 election.

(b) The query concerning the 2024 Olympics will be answered as No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Conversely, the same NOC must have claimed victory in at least two of these events for the question to be answered as Yes.

question.title: Given a Trump family member is the Republican nominee in 2024, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A member of the Trump family becomes the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

Then, will Donald Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat? There are two Manifold polls that close on July 6. One poll asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat. This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

para_P.title: If a member of the Trump family is the Republican candidate for the presidency in 2024, will Trump achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants against Biden?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: A Trump family member is selected as the Republican nominee for the US Presidential election in 2024. This could be Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

Then, will Donald Trump see an increase of at least 3% among Manifold participants when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat? There are two Manifold surveys that conclude on July 6. One survey inquires about votes for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks about votes for a generic Democrat. This question will be resolved as YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the survey with Joe Biden is at least 3% higher than in the survey with a generic Democrat when both surveys conclude. The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the result from poll 1 minus the result from poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 and (b) facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
(a) Resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

(b) Resolves **Yes** if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Manifold poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) a Trump family member will be the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024 and (b) will Trump receive at least 3% more support among Manifold respondents when competing against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
(a) This resolves **Yes** if any of the following individuals becomes the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

(b) This resolves **Yes** if the vote percentage for Donald Trump in the Manifold poll against Joe Biden surpasses that against a generic Democrat by 3% or greater when both polls conclude on July 6. The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve as N/A, and will remain open until the closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question may take into account new candidates that may emerge in the future.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the BSE SENSEX close between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024?

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.

para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be used to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be answered with YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and allow the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is not considered.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Given Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will 538 project him as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This means the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) have invoked Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024? This will resolve to “Yes” if Biden is projected as more likely to win than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast. It will resolve to “No” if Trump is projected as more likely to win. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this will resolve 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

para_P.title: If Biden is determined to be incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August, will 538 indicate him as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario holds: Biden is deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This implies that the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) have activated Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

In this case, is it accurate to say that Joe Biden will have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024? This will conclude as “Yes” if Biden is forecasted as more likely to win than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's analysis. It will conclude as “No” if Trump is forecasted as more likely to win. If both Biden and Trump have equal chances, this will resolve 50-50. The source for this resolution is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.
(b) 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024: This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19. Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen: (a) Biden is declared unfit under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) 538 shows Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is declared unfit under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.
(b) 538 shows Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024: This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for that date. If Biden and Trump have equal chances, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the figures indicated by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date. Changes in the way FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will not affect the resolution of this market. This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 becomes available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 data is available. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the nearest prior figures to July 19. Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

para_P.title: Is Albania set to make it to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Albania takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The inquiry will result in a **No** for any other scenarios concerning Albania.

question.title: Given Albania qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Iceland participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

para_P.title: If Albania secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Iceland also make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds: Albania takes part in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. In that case, will Iceland compete in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the EBU as having secured a place in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will both Albania and Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** if either or both countries do not qualify for the Grand Final.

para_P.title: Are Albania and Iceland both set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if the following conditions are met: (a) Albania competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Iceland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The inquiry will be deemed **No** if either or both nations fail to qualify for the Grand Final.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the leading candidate on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump is estimated to have a superior probability of winning the US presidential election relative to Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that both candidates have equal chances, this market will be resolved at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically using the data represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its figures will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will conclude based on the data for July 19 as soon as the figures for July 20 are released. It may not reach a conclusion until the July 20 data is available. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve using the most recent data prior to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the likelihood of each candidate winning, expressed as a percentage out of 100 rounded to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be taken into account.

question.title: Given 538 Projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected as the favorite over Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast, meaning he has a higher probability of winning than Trump based on the trend lines for that date.

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): This resolves to "Yes" if Biden has a higher probability of winning than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast for July 19, 2024. It resolves to "No" if Trump has a higher probability. If they have equal odds, it resolves 50-50.

Now, given this condition, consider the outcome: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average on July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): This resolves "Yes" if Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points as reported on the FiveThirtyEight national polling average chart for July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

para_P.title: On July 19, 2024, FiveThirtyEight predicts Biden as the frontrunner; will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assume the following is accurate: On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is forecasted to be the frontrunner against Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election analysis, indicating he has a greater chance of winning compared to Trump based on the projections for that date.

Criteria for determining the condition (P): This is deemed "Yes" if Biden is shown to have a higher chance of winning than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast for July 19, 2024. It is considered "No" if Trump is indicated to have a higher chance. If their chances are the same, it resolves to 50-50.

Now, based on this premise, evaluate the outcome: Will Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and at most 4 according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average on July 15, 2024?

Criteria for determining the outcome (Q): This is considered "Yes" if Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 2 and is at most 4 points as per the FiveThirtyEight national polling average chart for July 15, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, a figure of 2.4 implies Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden will have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19. The resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) on July 19, 2024, 538 will indicate Biden as the frontrunner, and (b) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 but no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden will be projected to have a higher chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump. The outcome will be determined by FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election, specifically the values shown by the blue and red trend lines for that date. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive these figures will not affect the outcome. If there are no data points available for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest prior figures to July 19. The resolution will consider the winning odds of each candidate as a percentage out of 100, reported to one decimal place.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be recorded as greater than 2 and at most 4 in the national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential election, as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in office as president until the end of July?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a yes if Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden still being president by the end of July, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between Joe Biden's status as president and the opposition within his party to an early nomination plan.

Condition: Joe Biden must still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Outcome of interest: Resolves YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures also suffice. Resolves NO if these criteria are not met by market close.

para_P.title: Assuming Joe Biden remains in office as president until the conclusion of July, will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate publicly oppose the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule by signing a letter?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between Joe Biden's presidency and the dissent among his party regarding an early nomination initiative.

Condition: Joe Biden must still hold the official position of president of the United States by 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Outcome of interest: Resolves YES if at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators sign a public letter against the early nomination initiative before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters that collectively gather 20 signatures will also be considered sufficient. Resolves NO if these conditions are not fulfilled by market close.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024 and will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate him early?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. (b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also satisfy this condition. If both conditions are not met, this question resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in office as president until the conclusion of July 2024, and will a minimum of 20 Democratic House or Senate members endorse a public letter against the proposal for his early nomination?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. (b) Before the market closes on Sunday, July 21, 2024, a public letter opposing the early nomination proposal is signed by at least 20 members of the House or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party. Additionally, multiple letters that collectively have 20 lawmakers' signatures would also meet this requirement. If either of these criteria is not satisfied, the inquiry will result in a NO.

question.title: Will Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Portugal does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Portugal set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Portugal takes part in a Semi-final and is formally recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Portugal fails to qualify, the inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Portugal qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Poland also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Poland qualify for the Grand Final as well? Poland must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for the question to resolve as Yes. If Poland does not qualify, the question resolves as No.

para_P.title: If Portugal secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Poland also make it through?
para_P.body: Assuming this is accurate: Portugal competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Poland also advance to the Grand Final? For the answer to be Yes, Poland must take part in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland fails to qualify, the answer will be No.

question.title: Will both Portugal and Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Portugal and Poland participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Portugal or Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Portugal and Poland set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both Portugal and Poland take part in their individual Semi-finals and are officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Should either Portugal or Poland fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by the value reported on 538's national polling average chart for the date of July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This resolves as **Yes** if more than one round is needed, indicating a brokered convention, and **No** if only one ballot is required.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is between 2 and 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, will there be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario holds: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 but not exceeding 4, according to the national polling average from 538. This information is derived from the data displayed on 538's national polling average chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure reflects a lead for Trump.

In that case, will the Democratic Party need to conduct more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the upcoming 2024 US presidential election? The answer is **Yes** if multiple rounds are necessary, indicating a brokered convention, and **No** if a single ballot suffices.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden will be determined by 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, and the value must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4. This will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.
(b) Democrats will have a brokered convention if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, this condition is not met.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) On July 15, 2024, Trump's margin over Biden will exceed 2 but not surpass 4, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) will the Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The difference in votes between Trump and Biden will be assessed based on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as indicated on the chart dated July 15, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, and this value must be more than 2 but at most 4. Metaculus will verify this on July 17, 2024.
(b) A brokered convention for the Democrats will occur if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one round of voting is necessary, this scenario is not fulfilled.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

para_P.title: Will the final value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, exceed 75,000 but not surpass 77,000?
para_P.body: This inquiry is determined by the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Conditional on the BSE SENSEX closing between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance. Then, will Donald Trump be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Assuming the BSE SENSEX finishes between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Donald Trump be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: Let’s consider this scenario: On July 21, 2024, the closing price of the BSE SENSEX is above 75,000 and at most 77,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance. In this case, will Donald Trump be appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Donald Trump is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will conclude with a **No**. This question may take into account new candidates introduced in the future. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is exclusively determined by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k? (b) Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be between 75,000 and 77,000? Additionally, will Donald Trump secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

(b) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** answer. Future candidates that may be introduced will also be taken into account.

It's important to note that the determination of who receives the Republican nomination will be based solely on the delegates' selection at the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), regardless of who the nominee is on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand during the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has appeared as a witness, either in-person or via remote means, at the [court proceedings](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the alleged "hush money" transactions involving Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump testifying at the hush money trial, will Iran initiate military action before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This question explores the potential correlation between two seemingly unrelated events: Donald Trump testifying at his trial concerning "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and Iran initiating military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory.

Criterion for condition: Credible sources must report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the specified trial.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, as officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory count. Proxy force actions do not count.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial, will Iran commence military operations prior to midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible link between two apparently unrelated occurrences: Donald Trump giving testimony at his trial regarding "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and Iran launching military operations on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones.

Condition criterion: Reliable sources must indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or virtually, at the mentioned trial.

Outcome resolution criteria: The question resolves to YES if Iran begins military operations on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, as officially reported by the Iranian government or through a consensus of reliable news sources. This encompasses airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic efforts. Only actions explicitly stated by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian soil are considered. Actions by proxy forces do not qualify.

If the condition is unmet, the question is deemed N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial? (b) Will Iran initiate a military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(b) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial? (b) Will Iran launch a military action before midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the trial related to the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(b) This market will be determined as "Yes" if Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, the market will be resolved as "No".

For this market's purposes, a "military operation" is defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime territory (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot located on Israeli soil, the market will be resolved as "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or corroborated by a consensus of credible news reports. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not be considered for the resolution of this market.

Only actions taken by Iranian forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have been initiated from Iranian territory, will be counted toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel carried out by proxy forces (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Francis Suarez going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the currently mentioned candidates; additional options may be included later.

For the purpose of this question, it is not significant who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Francis Suarez is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means he is the candidate chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of other candidates or the final nominee on the day of the election.

Given this scenario, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20? This will resolve as Yes if, at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the specified source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Should Francis Suarez become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This indicates he is the individual selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of other candidates or the final nominee on election day.

In light of this situation, will at least 10 Democratic Senators advocate for Biden to step aside prior to July 20? This will be considered a Yes if, at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time, the designated source indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators are urging Biden to withdraw. If not, it will be a No.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following take place: (a) Francis Suarez becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge in the future. question.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the decision of the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Given this scenario, we want to know if Joe Biden will announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

Resolution criteria: Joe Biden must make a definitive, public, official announcement that is unambiguous and conclusive, stating that he will not accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, the question resolves as No.

para_P.title: Assuming Will Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States, will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry considers the situation in which Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election. This choice is solely based on the votes of the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

Under this condition, we seek to determine if Joe Biden will make a public announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

Criteria for resolution: Joe Biden must issue a clear, public, and official statement that is unequivocal and definitive, declaring that he will not accept the nomination. If such a declaration is not made by the specified deadline, the question will be resolved as No.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Will Hurd will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This resolves as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (a) Hurd will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) Hurd will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is confirmed as **Yes** if Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This is confirmed as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement that he will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.
