question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he receive at least 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to cast their vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote for a typical Democrat on a similar ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, yet every other Democrat included in hypothetical surveys either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the views of Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll is at least 3% greater than in the second poll when both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the result is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A, and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Conditional on Trump gaining at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO.

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Suppose the following is true: The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. Then, will a group of at least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?

para_P.title: If Trump receives at least a 3% advantage among Manifold participants against Biden compared to a generic Democrat, will a coalition of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators urge Biden to withdraw his candidacy prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
There are two polls from Manifold that close on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their votes for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote for a generic Democrat. This question will be answered YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

According to Politico:

Two members from safe districts have already publicly asked Biden to step down. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local news that they believe Biden has no chance to win in November.

Behind the scenes, the activity is even more intense. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, with at least one draft urging Biden to conclude his campaign, as indicated by five sources familiar with these efforts.

This market will resolve YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party House Members or Senators collaborates to encourage Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to press him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter as reported above, or it could involve a group conversing with Biden in person and collectively requesting him to withdraw.

For a YES resolution, all five individuals must be part of the same collective message. Merely having five individuals independently stating to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient.

Any reports of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden to request he step aside will not meet the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's conclusion. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

Assuming it is true that the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close, then will a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party House Members or Senators collaborate to pressure Biden to withdraw before July 20th?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat? (2) Will a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
(1) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(2) This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Are the following two conditions likely to happen: (1) Will Trump achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold respondents when compared to Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat? (2) Will a collective of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators advocate for Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
(1) Two Manifold polls are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll queries Manifold respondents about their vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while another asks about their vote for a generic Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot. This market will conclude with a YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close. The calculation for the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the difference between the calculation for poll 1 and poll 2 is >= 0.03. Otherwise, it results in a NO.

(2) This market will resolve to YES if at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate stepping down from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could involve signing a letter or another method, such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively ask him to withdraw. All five individuals must be part of the same group communication. If five individuals independently express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, that will not be adequate for a YES result. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not fulfill this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before this market's deadline. If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden withdraw or be unable to proceed with the campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time, this market will be considered a yes. If not, it will be deemed a no.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Mike Pence be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for P: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: If Biden exits the race prior to July 20, will Mike Pence become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming that Joe Biden exits or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, will Mike Pence be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Criteria for determining P: Resolves to YES if Biden exits or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

Criteria for determining Q: Resolves to YES if Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20 and (b) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (b) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that (a) Biden exits the race prior to July 20 and (b) Mike Pence becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: (a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing the campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. (b) Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?
question.body:
This market will resolve YES, if Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

[image]

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Elon Musk will attend the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?
para_P.body:
This market will settle as YES if Elon Musk appears as a speaker on the main stage at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, which is among the biggest Bitcoin conferences, scheduled for July 25-27, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on Elon Musk attending Bitcoin Nashville 2024, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This market will resolve YES, if Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

Suppose the following is true: Elon Musk shows up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024.

Then, will Donald Trump be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for Trump removal: The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question resolves as "Yes" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024, and "No" if they are not.

para_P.title: If Elon Musk is present at Bitcoin Nashville 2024, will Donald Trump face removal or disqualification from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a YES if Elon Musk appears as a guest on the main stage at Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, scheduled for July 25-27, 2024.

Assuming the following holds true: Elon Musk attends Bitcoin Nashville 2024.

Then, will Donald Trump be officially removed or disqualified from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024?

Criteria for confirming Trump's removal: The removal or disqualification must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The inquiry resolves as "Yes" if these conditions are satisfied as of July 15, 2024, and "No" if they are not.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Elon Musk appears on stage at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

The question will resolve as NO if either condition (a) or (b) is not met.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Elon Musk takes the stage at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 event (b) Donald Trump is disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed YES if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied:

(a) Elon Musk appears as a participant on the main stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, which is one of the largest Bitcoin events, scheduled for July 25-27, 2024.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution. The inquiry specifically concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve as negative.

The inquiry will resolve as NO if either condition (a) or (b) is not satisfied.

question.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Retain Its EU Majority from Hungary in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, after the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance obtains a greater number of seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus preserving the largest share of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Conditional on Fidesz-KDNP maintaining its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024, will the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Fidesz-KDNP maintains its plurality of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament following the 2024 elections, meaning they secure more seats than any other single party or coalition according to credible sources. Given that this condition is met, will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024? This question resolves as **Yes** if credible sources report that before July 5, 2024, the EU has announced new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicle imports.

para_P.title: If Fidesz-KDNP continues to hold the most seats from Hungary in the EU after the 2024 elections, will the EU implement new tariffs on electric vehicles imported from China prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Fidesz-KDNP retains the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament after the 2024 elections, meaning they achieve more seats than any other individual party or coalition based on reliable information. Given this situation, will the European Union put in place new tariffs or charges on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024? This question will be resolved as **Yes** if credible sources indicate that the EU has announced new tariffs or charges on Chinese electric vehicle imports before July 5, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024 (b) The EU announces new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources. (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (a) The Fidesz-KDNP coalition retains its status as the largest Hungarian party in the EU for 2024 (b) The EU reveals new tariffs on electric vehicles from China prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if both of these criteria are satisfied: (a) After the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition achieves a greater number of seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus preserving the largest Hungarian representation in the European Parliament, based on trustworthy sources. (b) Before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared the introduction of new tariffs or fees that will be applicable to the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Given Poland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Denmark also qualify?
question.body: Suppose Poland qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, meaning Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final. Then, will Denmark qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? Denmark needs to participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final for this to resolve as Yes. If Denmark does not qualify, it resolves as No.

para_P.title: If Poland secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Denmark also make it through?
para_P.body: Assuming Poland secures its place in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, which entails Poland competing in a Semi-final and being officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Grand Final. In that case, will Denmark also make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024? For Denmark to be considered qualified, it must also compete in a Semi-final and be officially acknowledged by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final; otherwise, it will be deemed a No.

question.title: Will both Poland and Denmark qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Poland or Denmark does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Poland and Denmark set to reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (1) Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Denmark takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Poland or Denmark fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but no more than 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as presented on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on June 28th, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average. The value is reported as positive for a Trump lead and negative for a Biden lead, and this is verified on July 17, 2024.

Then, is it true that on June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's according to Companies Market Cap, as checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC)?

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, will Nvidia's valuation surpass that of Apple on June 28, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and at most 3, based on 538's national polling average. A positive value indicates a Trump lead while a negative one indicates a Biden lead, and this will be confirmed on July 17, 2024.

Then, is it accurate to say that Nvidia's market cap will be greater than Apple's on June 28, 2024, as reported by Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC)?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden will be determined by the 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, and the lead should be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points.

(b) Nvidia's market capitalization will be compared to Apple's on June 28, 2024, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). The question resolves **Yes** if Nvidia's market cap is greater than Apple's on that date.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Nvidia's market value surpasses that of Apple on June 28, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The extent of Trump's advantage over Biden will be assessed using the 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, which will be reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, and this lead must be more than 2 and at most 3 points.

(b) Nvidia's market value will be evaluated against Apple's on June 28, 2024, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). The outcome will be **Yes** if Nvidia's market value is greater than Apple's on that specific date.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA emerge as the group with the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction possesses the highest seat count after the 2024 elections for the European Parliament, and will be marked as **No** for any other results. In the event that two factions are equal in seat count, both sub-questions will be recorded as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: If Greens–EFA holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

Then, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024? The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Should the Greens–EFA be the leading party after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to everyone in the EU by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: The Greens–EFA political faction has the largest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will be marked as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction has the largest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and as **No** for any other scenarios. In the event of a tie between two groups for seats, both sub-questions will be marked as **Yes**. This inquiry will be determined based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media sources.

Consequently, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union by June 30, 2024? The inquiry will be marked as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

Here, "accessible to the general public" means that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (potentially requiring payment). If it is not available in certain EU nations (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or not available to (for instance) minors, this will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers specifically to the general online interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered a positive outcome if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Is it possible for both the following to happen: (a) the Greens–EFA group to secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT to be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction has the highest seat count after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and will be marked as **No** for all other scenarios. In the event of a tie between two groups for seat count, both components will be considered **Yes**. The resolution of this question will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media sources.

(b) The question will be marked as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not. Here, "broadly accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in specific EU nations (as was observed in Italy in early 2023), or inaccessible to certain groups (like minors), it will still be deemed a positive outcome, provided that over 50% of the population can utilize it. The term "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered a positive result even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to enter queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

para_P.title: Will the critics' score for "Twisters" (2024) on Rotten Tomatoes reach 75% or more? ("Certified Fresh")
para_P.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This will be considered a YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or above, one week following its release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will rely on whatever precision is provided by Rotten Tomatoes (usually an integer percentage, no decimals).

For instance, the original "Twister" (1996) has a current Tomatometer of 63%. This is the score I will reference.

The term "Certified Fresh" is mentioned for illustrative reasons (to my knowledge, it necessitates a Tomatometer of at least 75%, but there could be additional criteria—the market resolves exclusively based on the score shown).

"Twisters" (2024) is an independent sequel to the original 1996 film, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), featuring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, given "Twisters" (2024) is "Certified Fresh"?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: "Twisters" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% one week after its release, as displayed on its Rotten Tomatoes page. This score is used to determine if the movie is "Certified Fresh" for the purposes of this question.

Given this condition, will the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than $185,548,391? This resolves as Yes if the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" reported by Boxofficemojo is higher than the combined opening of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), which is $185,548,391. If "Twisters" does not achieve a score of at least 75% on Rotten Tomatoes, the condition is not met and this question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Will the first weekend earnings of "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceed the total of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" when "Twisters" (2024) is rated "Certified Fresh"?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: "Twisters" (2024) receives a Rotten Tomatoes critics rating of no less than 75% one week post-release, as indicated on its Rotten Tomatoes listing. This rating is the criterion for determining if the film is considered "Certified Fresh" in this context.

Under this premise, will the initial domestic box office earnings for "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpass $185,548,391? This will be considered a Yes if the reported domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" on Boxofficemojo exceeds the combined earnings of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), which total $185,548,391. If "Twisters" fails to attain a score of at least 75% on Rotten Tomatoes, the condition is unmet and this inquiry will be deemed N/A.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes score of at least 75% one week after release AND will "Deadpool & Wolverine" have a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 
(a) "Twisters" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes Tomatometer score of 75% or higher one week after its release on July 26th, as displayed on its Rotten Tomatoes page. The score is based on the integer percentage listed by Rotten Tomatoes. 
(b) The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" is higher than $185,548,391, which is the combined opening of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), as reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page.

para_P.title: Will the film "Twisters" (2024) achieve a Rotten Tomatoes rating of 75% or more within a week of its release, and will "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpass the domestic box office opening of both "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: 
(a) "Twisters" (2024) receives a Rotten Tomatoes Tomatometer score of 75% or above one week after its premiere on July 26th, as shown on its Rotten Tomatoes page. This score is determined by the whole number percentage provided by Rotten Tomatoes. 
(b) The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceeds $185,548,391, which is the total opening of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), according to Boxofficemojo's reporting on the film's page.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdon at D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Disney will reveal a new Moana attraction for Magic Kingdom during D23 2024?
para_P.body: This will be considered YES if Disney officially reveals a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or prior to the D23 event in August 2024. It will be deemed NO if it is merely talked about in a brainstorming context similar to how some attractions were mentioned at the last D23. It will also be NO if a Moana attraction is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting will close on August 8, the day before the event. The outcome will be determined after the convention.

question.title: Conditional on Disney announcing a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024, will Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
This question explores the potential correlation between two independent events: Disney's announcement of a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024, and the box office performance of the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.

Criterion for the condition: Resolves YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It resolves NO if it is only discussed as an idea or if announced for a different park.

Criterion for the outcome: Resolves YES if "Deadpool x Wolverine" grosses more than $284.5M globally in its opening weekend and is reported as the record for an R-rated movie release by the Hollywood Reporter or equivalent publication. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Disney reveals a new Moana attraction for Magic Kingdom during D23 2024, will the opening weekend for Deadpool & Wolverine be the highest ever for an R-rated film?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible relationship between two separate occurrences: Disney's declaration of a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or prior to the D23 convention in August 2024, and the box office results of the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film.

Condition criteria: Resolves YES if Disney declares a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or prior to the D23 convention in August 2024. It resolves NO if it is merely mentioned as a concept or if announced for a different park.

Outcome criteria: Resolves YES if "Deadpool x Wolverine" earns over $284.5M worldwide in its opening weekend and is documented as the record for an R-rated film release by the Hollywood Reporter or a similar publication. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not satisfied, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024 (b) Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
This question will resolve YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports, and the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release. Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for the film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, with expectations between $340 million and $360 million globally. Domestically, it is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time. The record for the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic). BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) Disney to unveil a new Moana attraction at Magic Kingdom during D23 2024 (b) Deadpool & Wolverine to achieve the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) Disney reveals a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or prior to the D23 convention in August 2024. It will be answered with NO if it is mentioned in a speculative manner similar to how some attractions were talked about at the last D23. It will also be answered with NO if a Moana attraction is introduced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting will close on August 8, the day before the convention, and the resolution will occur after the convention.

(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film earns over $284.5 million globally during its opening weekend according to reports, with the Hollywood Reporter (or a similar publication) declaring it as the record for an R-rated film release. Analysts are anticipating a massive opening weekend for the film, directed by Shawn Levy and featuring Ryan Reynolds, with expectations ranging from $340 million to $360 million globally. Domestically, it is projected to open with $160 million to $170 million, which would establish it as the largest R-rated opening in history. The current record for the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated film is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic). BoxOfficeMojo figures should be regarded as unofficial until confirmed by the Hollywood press.

question.title: Will Belgium qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Belgium going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Belgium takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: If Belgium qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Czechia also qualify?
question.body:
This question examines the qualification of Czechia for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, given that Belgium has already qualified. 

Resolution criteria for Belgium (Condition): Belgium must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Resolution criteria for Czechia (Outcome): Czechia must participate in a Semi-final and then be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

If Belgium does not qualify, this question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Should Belgium make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Czechia also make it?
para_P.body:
This inquiry explores the possibility of Czechia's qualification for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, contingent upon Belgium's successful qualification. 

Criteria for Belgium's qualification (Condition): Belgium is required to compete in a Semi-final and be officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024.

Criteria for Czechia's qualification (Outcome): Czechia must also participate in a Semi-final and subsequently be officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024.

If Belgium fails to qualify, this inquiry will be deemed N/A.

question.title: Will both Belgium and Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Belgium and Czechia participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Belgium or Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Belgium and Czechia set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both Belgium and Czechia take part in their individual Semi-finals and are officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Grand Final for Eurovision 2024. Should either Belgium or Czechia fail to qualify, the outcome will be a **No**.

question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Czechia set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Czechia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Czechia fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Czechia qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Azerbaijan also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Azerbaijan also qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria:

- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Azerbaijan participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Azerbaijan does not qualify, the outcome resolves as **No**.
- If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Czechia makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Azerbaijan also make it?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Czechia competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Azerbaijan also advance to the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is satisfied if Czechia is confirmed as qualified for the Grand Final as stated.
- The outcome is determined as **Yes** if Azerbaijan competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the EBU as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Azerbaijan fails to qualify, the outcome is determined as **No**.

question.title: Will both Czechia and Azerbaijan qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Czechia and Azerbaijan participate in their respective Semi-finals and are then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Czechia or Azerbaijan does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Czechia and Azerbaijan set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be determined as **Yes** if both Czechia and Azerbaijan take part in their individual Semi-finals and are subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Should either Czechia or Azerbaijan fail to qualify, the inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden that exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure denotes a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. This is determined by accessing 538's national polling average chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that before May 1, 2024, credible reports will indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals? The attack must occur after the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, to be considered.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, will there be a lethal strike by Israel inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3, as per 538's national polling average for the upcoming presidential election in 2024. This will be verified by checking 538's national polling average chart on July 17, 2024, where any positive figure signifies a lead for Trump.

Is it then accurate to say that before May 1, 2024, reliable sources will report that an assault linked to Israel, taking place within the borders of Iran, has resulted in the deaths of at least five people? The incident must happen after this question is published and before May 1, 2024, to qualify.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

2. Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's margin over Biden be more than 2 but at most 3 in 538's national polling average, and will there be a lethal assault by Israel inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. According to 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/), Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as indicated on the chart for that date when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump.

2. After the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, there are credible reports of an assault linked to Israel that has occurred within the territory of Iran, resulting in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) experience an increase compared to the same date last year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: The resolution of this inquiry will depend on the data provided by the St. Louis Fed at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure for July 20, 2024 must exceed the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Conditional on the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index being higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question combines two conditions:

1. **Condition**: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) must be higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023. This will be verified based on the St. Louis Fed's reporting at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

2. **Outcome of Interest**: Israel must carry out a deadly attack within Iran's borders resulting in the death of at least five individuals, as indicated by credible reports, between the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024.

The question resolves **Yes** if both conditions are met, **No** if the first condition is met but the second is not, and **N/A** if the first condition is not met.

para_P.title: Assuming the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is greater Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Israel conduct a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry consists of two criteria:

1. **Criterion**: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) needs to be higher on July 20, 2024, compared to its value on July 20, 2023. This will be confirmed using data from the St. Louis Fed available at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

2. **Desired Outcome**: Israel is required to execute a lethal operation within the territory of Iran that results in the fatalities of at least five people, as verified by credible sources, between the date this question is published and before May 1, 2024.

The answer will be **Yes** if both criteria are fulfilled, **No** if the first criterion is satisfied but the second is not, and **N/A** if the first criterion is not met.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) must be higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023, according to the St. Louis Fed's report: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. (b) Credible reports must indicate that, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events expected to take place: (a) Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) show an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? (b) Will Israel execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) needs to be greater on July 20, 2024, compared to its value on July 20, 2023, as per the St. Louis Fed's analysis: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. (b) Reliable sources must confirm that, after the date of this inquiry's publication and before May 1, 2024, an assault linked to Israel occurring within Iran has resulted in the deaths of no fewer than five people.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tucker Carlson going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other individual being chosen will conclude as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently recognized; additional options may be introduced in the future.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No** for this condition. This selection is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that the Republican Party will retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election? This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: If Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the Republican Party keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the upcoming special election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This implies that if any other individual is chosen, the outcome will be **No** for this condition. The nominee is decided exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Therefore, is it correct to say that the Republican Party will maintain Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly represented by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election? This inquiry will be answered with Yes if trustworthy sources indicate that a candidate affiliated with the Republican Party has succeeded in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports, an Ohio State source or declaration will be referenced. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson). If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Tucker Carlson will be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the Republican Party will keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Tucker Carlson is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) Reliable sources indicate that a representative of the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson). In cases of conflicting information from popular sources, an official Ohio State source or statement will be referenced. Should no election occur before January 1, 2025, the question will be void.
