question.title: Conditional on Nikki Haley being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024?

para_P.title: Assuming Nikki Haley is the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden remain in office by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the scenario where Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than by the individual who is named the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

Under these circumstances, will Joe Biden still hold the position of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. 

If both conditions are met, the question resolves to **Yes**. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves to **No**.

para_P.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and will Joe Biden remain president until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the decision made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. 

If both criteria are fulfilled, the inquiry resolves to **Yes**. If either or both criteria are not fulfilled, the inquiry resolves to **No**.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to stay in office until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Conditional on Biden remaining President through the end of July 2024, will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect this condition, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

Then, is it true that Ron DeSantis will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected as the nominee by the Republican National Convention. It will resolve as **No** for all other candidates. The question is not restricted to currently listed candidates; other options may be added in the future. The resolution is solely determined by the selection at the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Assuming Biden stays in office until the end of July 2024, will Ron DeSantis be the chosen candidate for the Republican party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider this scenario: Biden continues to serve as US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET). This implies that he does not resign, pass away, or otherwise stop being President before that date. It’s important to note that a temporary handover of power under the 25th amendment does not change this condition, as the Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution.

In this case, is it accurate to say that Ron DeSantis will be nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is nominated by the Republican National Convention. It will be resolved as **No** for any other candidates. The question is not limited to those currently announced; additional candidates may emerge later. The outcome is determined exclusively by the nomination at the Republican National Convention, rather than who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through end of July 2024 and (b) Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). Resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Biden stays in office as President until the end of July 2024 and (b) Ron DeSantis becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden continues to serve as the US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (Eastern Time). A NO resolution will occur if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution).

(b) Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made solely based on who the delegates of the Republican National Convention select, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview occurred when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

This market will resolve to YES if Biden engages in another in-person interview that lasts at least 45 minutes. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. However, it may include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews that are edited into programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for those appearances to count. For example, a 50-minute video might only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his guest spot on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have each contained less than 30 minutes of footage featuring Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Given Joe Biden has an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera lasting at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, or rallies, but can include appearances on a podcast, late night show, or interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Then, is it also true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This is determined by the reported value on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 3 but be 4 or fewer on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden engages in a direct interview or on-camera discussion that lasts no less than 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, or rallies, but may include guest appearances on podcasts, late-night television shows, or edited interviews featured in programs like 60 Minutes, as long as there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage showing Biden being interviewed in person.

Then, can we also assert that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 3 and at most 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This will be determined by the figure reported on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as of July 15, 2024, which will be accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number indicates a lead for Trump.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and will Trump's lead over Biden be between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) Joe Biden must have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. The interview can be on a podcast, late night show, or a show like 60 minutes, but must include at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. 

(2) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The value will be accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

para_P.title: By the end of July 2024, will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview lasting over 45 minutes, and will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden fall between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, as per 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden is required to take part in a face-to-face interview or on-camera discussion for no less than 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, town halls, etc. The interview may occur on a podcast, late-night television show, or a program like 60 Minutes, but it must consist of at least 45 minutes of fresh footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person. 

(2) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump must have a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 3 points and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive value signifies a Trump lead. This value will be evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating efforts to voice opposition to their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they believe suppresses the critical ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still quite troubled about the prospects of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a smart tactic to close off debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t function that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures combined would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.body:
Context from Politico:

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

para_P.title: Should at least 20 Democrats in the House or Senate publicly oppose the early nomination strategy for it to be certain that Larry Elder will be the Republican nominee in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating efforts to voice their discontent with their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination earlier than initially intended, claiming it suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

For this question, it is irrelevant who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, and will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden early, and will Larry Elder be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This could be in the form of a single statement or several statements that collectively gather 20 endorsements. (b) Larry Elder must be designated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for an athlete to secure multiple medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any athlete achieves a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Given an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This means any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, is it true that Individual Neutral Athletes will collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, according to the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. Otherwise, it resolves to "No". If confirmed before the end of the Games that they have won 21 or more gold medals, it resolves immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: If an athlete secures multiple tennis medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes achieve at least 21 gold medals?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: An athlete secures multiple medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, meaning that any athlete obtains a minimum of two tennis medals during the event. Then, is it accurate to say that Individual Neutral Athletes will together earn 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

The criteria for determining the outcome: This will be considered "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively earn 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources. If it is confirmed before the conclusion of the Games that they have indeed won 21 or more gold medals, it will immediately be resolved as "Yes".

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) At least one athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, this condition is considered met immediately.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A tennis player secures more than one medal (b) Individual Neutral Athletes achieve 21 or more gold medals?
para_P.body:
This inquiry resolves as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) At least one tennis player wins two or more medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) Individual Neutral Athletes, in total, earn 21 or more gold medals during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if the IOC's reporting is not available. If it is confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, this condition will be deemed fulfilled immediately.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be more than 2 but at most 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates Biden's lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the recorded value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Given this situation, the question asks whether Kamala Harris will be nominated as the Democratic Vice President. If Kamala Harris is nominated, the answer is YES. If someone else is selected as VP, the answer is NO. The resolution is based on the initial nomination and will not change if the VP is changed after the nomination.

para_P.title: Assuming that Trump's advantage over Biden falls between 2 and 4 on July 15, 2024, will Kamala Harris be the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation in which Donald Trump holds a lead over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential race, specifically when that lead is more than 2 but not exceeding 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to Metaculus's report on July 17, 2024. In this scenario, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump.

In light of this context, the question seeks to determine if Kamala Harris will be put forward as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate. Should Kamala Harris receive the nomination, the answer would be YES. Conversely, if another individual is chosen as VP, the answer would be NO. The resolution hinges on the original nomination and remains unchanged even if the VP is altered post-nomination.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Trump's margin over Biden be more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Kamala Harris be the Democratic nominee for VP?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. (b) If Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If another individual is appointed as VP, this market will resolve to no. Any changes to the VP position after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately following the nomination.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by the value reported on the 538 national polling average chart for the 2024 presidential election as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. Then, is it true that Glenn Youngkin will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This is determined by who is chosen as the nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on election day.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 3 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, will Glenn Youngkin be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has an advantage over Joe Biden that is greater than 3 and not exceeding 4 based on 538's national polling average. This is ascertained from the value shown on the 538 national polling average chart for the 2024 presidential election as viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Background from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to oppose their party’s move to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they believe suppresses the critical ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker participating in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, serves as the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are significantly concerned about the direction of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and somehow force unity, but that’s not how it operates,” Huffman mentioned in an interview. He chose not to verify the existence of the letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement opposing the expedited nomination initiative is endorsed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: If Ted Cruz becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Kamala's chances of winning rise in the coming week based on Nate Silver's model?
para_P.body:
Assuming Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, this inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is confirmed as the nominee by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

In this context, will Kamala Harris's chances of victory improve according to Nate Silver's model? More precisely, the question will be marked **Yes** if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It will be marked **No** in all other cases.

Link to model: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 

1. Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. The Electoral College probability for Kamala Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as **Yes**. If either condition is not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to happen: (a) Ted Cruz will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Kamala's chances of winning will rise in the next week according to Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: 

1. Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. The probability assigned to Kamala Harris by Nate Silver's model in the Electoral College exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM.

For this question to resolve as **Yes**, both criteria must be met. If either criterion is not satisfied, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Switzerland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Switzerland fails to qualify, the inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Switzerland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Portugal qualify as well?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Portugal participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

para_P.title: If Switzerland secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, does that mean Portugal will also secure a spot?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. In that case, will Portugal also compete in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the EBU as qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will both Switzerland and Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Switzerland and Portugal participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Switzerland or Portugal does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Switzerland and Portugal set to advance to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both Switzerland and Portugal take part in their individual Semi-finals and are confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Should either Switzerland or Portugal fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will the French Prime Minister be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if the coalition of the French Prime Minister is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Conditional on the Prime Minister of France not belonging to New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024. This will be determined if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

Then, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Assuming that the Prime Minister of France is not affiliated with either the New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, will the ID political group secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the following scenario: The Prime Minister of France is part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024. This determination will be made based on credible sources confirming that the Prime Minister's party is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time.

Under these conditions, will the ID political group achieve the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the ID political group has the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will be a **No** for all other political groups. In cases where two groups have an equal number of seats, both sub-questions will be answered as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will depend on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media reports.

question.title: Will BOTH of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024 (b) The ID political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) This component resolves as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.
(b) This component resolves as Yes if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as No for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as Yes. This resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Is it true that BOTH of the following will happen: (a) On July 30, 2024, the Prime Minister of France will be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together, and (b) the ID political group will secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
(a) This part will be considered Yes if, as of July 30th at 12:00 Central European Time, the party of the Prime Minister of France is not affiliated with New Popular Front or Together, based on reliable sources.
(b) This part will be regarded as Yes if the ID political group has the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. All other political groups will be marked as No. In the event of a tie between two groups for the number of seats, both components will be marked as Yes. This determination will rely on official announcements from the European Parliament or trustworthy media coverage.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be included later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Ted Cruz is the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024? This will be assessed based on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

para_P.title: Should Ted Cruz become the Republican candidate, will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden that exceeds 2 but does not surpass 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is nominated on the election day.

Then, can we say that Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024? This will be evaluated using the data for July 15, 2024, as retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.** This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. **Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024.** This is based on the value reported for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) Ted Cruz becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Trump's advantage over Biden falls between greater than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, as per 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. **Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.** This determination is made based on the selection by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. **Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) exceeds 2 and is at most 3 on July 15, 2024.** This is based on the figure reported for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number indicates a lead for Trump.

question.title: Conditional on Liz Cheney being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question combines two forecasting scenarios:

1. **Condition**: Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of any other candidates.

2. **Outcome**: Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, and official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

Resolution: If Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee, then the question resolves YES if Joe Biden makes such an announcement before the deadline, and NO if he does not. If Liz Cheney is not the Republican nominee, the question resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Liz Cheney is the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry encompasses two forecasting situations:

1. **Condition**: Liz Cheney is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, independent of any other contenders.

2. **Outcome**: Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal and definitive.

Resolution: If Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee, then the question resolves to YES if Joe Biden makes such a declaration before the cutoff time, and NO if he does not. If Liz Cheney is not the Republican nominee, the question resolves to N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Liz Cheney becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Liz Cheney becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Liz Cheney is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden declares before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) Liz Cheney is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be considered as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently presented; additional options may emerge in the future. It is exclusively determined by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Joe Biden declares before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This will be marked as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not pursue and will not accept the nomination from his party for another term as President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic nomination for the 2024 election cycle. If such an announcement is not made before the deadline, this question will be marked as No.

The main source for determining the outcome of this market will be official announcements from the US government, although a consensus of reliable news sources will also be considered.
