question.title: If Kamala Harris becomes President by Friday, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This will be determined by official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Then, given this condition, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024? The question resolves **Yes** if such charges or indictments occur before the specified date.

para_P.title: Should Kamala Harris assume the presidency by Friday, will Donald Trump face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This will be established by authoritative information from the US government or a consensus of reliable news sources.

Given this scenario, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering concerning potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024? The question is resolved as **Yes** if such charges or indictments take place before the designated date.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This condition resolves to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, but a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

(b) This condition resolves to "Yes" if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President of the United States prior to July 26, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This condition will be considered "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, supplemented by a consensus of reliable news reports.

(b) This condition will be considered "Yes" if Donald Trump is formally charged or indicted regarding any remarks related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden going to declare that he is withdrawing from the presidential race and stepping down from his position before July concludes?
para_P.body:
This will be resolved as YES if Joe Biden makes a statement indicating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he intends to resign, thereby not finishing his existing term. Such announcements must occur prior to the end of July 2024, according to Pacific Time; however, he is not required to have formally resigned or vacated his office by then. A declaration of his plan to do so will suffice to settle this market.

If this does not occur, the market will resolve as NO on August 1st.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July, will USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. This means he announces his intention to not complete his current term and not run for re-election. The actual resignation does not have to occur by the end of July, just the announcement.

Given this, will the USD/JPY exchange rate be at least 145 yen per USD at the close of trading on August 9th, 2024, as listed on Yahoo! Finance?

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden declare his intention to withdraw from the presidential race and step down from office prior to the conclusion of July, will the value of USD reach or exceed 145 JPY at the market close on August 9th, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden makes an announcement that he is both ceasing his campaign for re-election and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. This indicates his decision to not finish his current term and to not seek re-election. The actual resignation is not required to take place by the end of July, only the announcement needs to occur.

In light of this, will the USD/JPY exchange rate be at a minimum of 145 yen per USD at the close of trading on August 9th, 2024, according to Yahoo! Finance?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before the end of July 2024 that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency, and (b) USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this component resolves NO on August 1st.

(b) Resolves YES if USD/JPY close is listed as >= 145 on August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Joe Biden declares prior to the conclusion of July 2024 that he is withdrawing from the presidential race and resigning from his position, and (b) the USD will be valued at 145 JPY or more at the close on August 9th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if Joe Biden makes announcements stating that he is not seeking re-election and that he will step down from his current role, with these declarations needing to be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. It is not necessary for him to have officially resigned and vacated his office by the end of July; a statement of his intention to do so is adequate to resolve this market positively.

If not, this part will be marked as NO on August 1st.

(b) This will be marked as YES if the closing exchange rate of USD/JPY is reported as 145 or higher on Yahoo! Finance on August 9th, 2024.

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommend that Tesla investors oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation plan or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
para_P.body: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla investors to vote *against* Elon Musk's remuneration package during the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the board of directors. If not, the question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: If ISS advises against Musk's package or re-election, will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, the question will resolve as **No**.

Suppose the above condition is true. Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Should ISS recommend against Musk's compensation or re-election, will Donald Trump Jr. secure the Republican nomination for 2024?
para_P.body:
The question will yield a resolution of **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's compensation package during the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board. If neither of these conditions is met, the question will resolve as **No**.

Assuming the aforementioned condition holds true, will Donald Trump Jr. be chosen as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will result in a **No**. This inquiry is not confined to the candidates currently under consideration; additional candidates may emerge in the future. For this question, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is determined solely by the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will BOTH of the following occur: (1) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advises Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk, AND (2) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) The first condition will resolve as **Yes** if ISS releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

(2) The second condition will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that BOTH of the following will take place: (1) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommends that Tesla shareholders oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk, AND (2) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) The first condition will be classified as **Yes** if ISS issues a statement clearly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's compensation package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. If not, it will be classified as **No**.

(2) The second condition will be classified as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be classified as **No**. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is not relevant; it is solely based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Crimean Bridge will experience an attack prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, following May 2, 2024, and before the specified date, [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been targeted by gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could threaten the structural integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Given the Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. Then, is it true that Joe Biden will still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024?

para_P.title: If the Crimean Bridge experiences an attack prior to July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden remain in office until the end of July?
para_P.body: Assuming the following scenario is accurate: Between May 2, 2024, and July 1, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been targeted with gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could significantly threaten the structure of the bridge. In that case, is it accurate to say that Joe Biden will still hold the position of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge; and (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) An attack on the Crimean Bridge occurs prior to July 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden remains in office as president at the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Between May 2, 2024, and July 1, 2024, [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been targeted with gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could significantly threaten the structural integrity of the bridge; and (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will the ICC issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This occurs if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then, is it true that before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) will issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)? It resolves as Yes if such a warrant is issued before July 1, 2024, and No otherwise.

para_P.title: Should Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, will the ICC release arrest warrants for any Israeli officials listed before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Biden is deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024. This situation arises if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., or the invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not apply.

Then, is it accurate that prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) will issue an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli government officials: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)? The answer is Yes if such a warrant is issued before July 1, 2024, and No otherwise.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (b) the ICC issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of these events will take place: (a) Biden being officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024, and (b) the ICC issuing arrest warrants for any of the specified Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate entity) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not applicable.

(b) This question will be considered **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant for arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below. It will be marked as **No** in all other cases.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024 indicating that he will not accept the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024 indicating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign delivers a clear, public, official statement declaring that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Additional details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Please reach out to @jskf for early resolution requests or to report any issues.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden makes a definitive, public, and official announcement before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. This announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.

Then, is it true that Chris Christie will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution for this question is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will Chris Christie be the Republican candidate for 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Joe Biden issues a clear, public, and official statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not run for or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election cycle. This statement must be clear-cut and final, with no chance of him accepting the nomination.

In that case, is it accurate to say that Chris Christie will be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The answer to this question is determined exclusively by the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention regarding the nominee, rather than who is announced as the nominee on election day.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (2) Chris Christie is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(2) Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This resolves as Yes if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (1) Joe Biden declares prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, and (2) Chris Christie becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be explicit and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(2) Will Chris Christie be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This resolves as Yes if Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined solely by who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will the opening weekend earnings of "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpass the combined total of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the opening weekend earnings for **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) exceed $185,548,391, which is the total of the opening earnings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Conditional on "Deadpool & Wolverine" having a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, will "House of the Dragon" S2E8 be rated >8.5 on IMDB, 2 days after release?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box office openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013). This is verified by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page.

Then, is it true that "House of the Dragon" Season 2 Episode 8 (season finale) will have an IMDB rating greater than 8.5, two days after its release? The resolution is based on the score displayed on IMDB two days after release, at noon PT. The score must be a strict inequality (>8.5) and will use the precision listed by IMDB, typically a single decimal.

para_P.title: Given that "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpasses the domestic box office opening of both "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, will the IMDB rating for "House of the Dragon" Season 2 Episode 8 exceed 8.5 two days post-release?

Then, is it accurate to say that the IMDB rating for "House of the Dragon" Season 2 Episode 8 (the season finale) will be greater than 8.5, two days after it is released? The determination is based on the rating displayed on IMDB two days after its release, at noon PT. The rating must be strictly greater than 8.5 and will use the precision provided by IMDB, usually to one decimal place.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined? (b) "House of the Dragon" S2E8 (season finale) be rated >8.5 on IMDB, 2 days after release?

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his withdrawal from the presidential race and his resignation from office prior to the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
This will be resolved as YES if Joe Biden makes a declaration that he is no longer pursuing re-election and that he intends to resign, thereby not finishing his current presidential term. Such declarations must occur before the end of July 2024, in Pacific Time; however, it is not necessary for him to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that time. A statement of his intention to resign will be adequate to resolve this market.

If he does not make such announcements, this market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning before the end of July, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. This means he announces his intention to not complete his current term and to drop out of the race. Note that he does not have to have formally resigned by the end of July, just announced his intention to do so. Given this, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering related to potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024? The indictment must occur before June 1, 2024 for the resolution to be YES.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden declare his withdrawal from the presidential race and step down prior to the end of July, will Donald Trump face charges for witness tampering in Georgia ahead of June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: Imagine the following scenario: Joe Biden makes an announcement that he is no longer pursuing re-election and intends to resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. This indicates his decision to not finish his current term and to exit the race. It is important to note that he only needs to announce his intention to resign by the end of July, not necessarily complete the formal resignation. In light of this situation, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering concerning potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* prior to June 1, 2024? For the answer to be YES, the indictment must take place before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning before the end of July 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this component.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

The combined question resolves YES if both (a) and (b) occur as described.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will happen: (a) Joe Biden makes an announcement about withdrawing from the race and resigning prior to the conclusion of July 2024, and (b) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden declares that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and intends to resign from his current position, with these announcements taking place before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. He does not need to have officially left office by that time; a statement of his plan to resign is adequate for this part to resolve positively.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted regarding any remarks pertaining to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. These charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

The overall question will resolve YES if both (a) and (b) occur as specified.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Iceland set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Iceland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Otherwise, it will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Given Iceland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Ireland also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ireland qualify for the Grand Final? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Iceland secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, can we expect Ireland to also make it through?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Iceland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, can we expect Ireland to also make it to the Grand Final? This question will be answered with **Yes** if Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the EBU as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Iceland and Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Iceland and Ireland participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Iceland and Ireland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both Iceland and Ireland take part in their respective Semi-finals and are officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Should either or both fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris be the president by Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If this does not occur, the market will settle on "No".

The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable news reports will also be taken into account.

Resolver

question.title: If Kamala Harris is President by Friday, will 20 Democrats oppose early Biden nomination?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this event will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Then, in this scenario, will at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden early? This resolves YES if such a letter is signed by at least 20 lawmakers before the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures also count. If these criteria are not met by market close, this resolves NO.

para_P.title: Should Kamala Harris become President by Friday, will 20 Democrats express opposition to an early Biden nomination?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The main source for determining this event will be official announcements from the US government, but credible media consensus will also be considered.

In this context, will at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators publicly sign a letter against the initiative to nominate President Joe Biden early? This will be marked as YES if such a letter is signed by a minimum of 20 legislators before the conclusion of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters that together have 20 signatures are acceptable as well. If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this will be marked as NO.

question.title: Will both Kamala Harris become President by July 26, 2024, and at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the early nomination of Biden by July 21, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting; (2) A public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden early is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21, 2024. Otherwise, this question resolves to "No".

para_P.title: Is it possible for Kamala Harris to assume the presidency by July 26, 2024, while at least 20 Democrats in the House or Senate publicly oppose Biden's early nomination by July 21, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official announcements from the US government or a consensus of reliable news sources; (2) A public letter against the early nomination of President Joe Biden is endorsed by no fewer than 20 House Representatives or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the conclusion of Sunday, July 21, 2024. If these conditions are not met, the answer will be "No".

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, will he see an increase of at least 3% among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to vote alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a generic Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat in hypothetical scenarios is either leading or within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll is at least 3% higher than in the second poll when both polls close. 

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is 0.03 or greater. Otherwise, the result is NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A, and will remain open until the designated close time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Given Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden, will Kamala Harris’ VP pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

Suppose the above is true: Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat. Then, will Kamala Harris’ VP pick be Kelly or Shapiro?

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate. I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

para_P.title: If Trump receives a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold voters against Joe Biden, will Kamala Harris select Kelly or Shapiro as her running mate?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll requests Manifold voters to express their choice with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a generic Democrat in the same scenario.

This question will be deemed YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more upon closure of both polls. The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the difference between the first poll's formula and the second poll's formula is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

Assuming the above condition holds: Trump secures at least 3% more support from Manifold voters against Joe Biden compared to a generic Democrat. Then, will Kamala Harris announce her choice for VP to be either Kelly or Shapiro?

This market will resolve to YES when Kamala Harris declares her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. It will resolve to NO if she announces anyone else as her choice. I will wait for Kamala herself to confirm the pick before resolving this.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, and (b) Kamala Harris’ VP Pick is either Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th. This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate. The pick must be confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Trump receives a minimum of 3% more support among Manifold respondents when pitted against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, and (b) Kamala Harris selects either Kelly or Shapiro as her VP?
para_P.body:
(a) Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to cast their vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while another asks for their vote with a generic Democrat. Public opinion surveys consistently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump outside the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat in hypothetical scenarios is either leading or within the margin of error. This market will be marked YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater upon both polls closing. The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES is confirmed if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, it will be marked NO.

(b) The leading candidates for Kamala’s vice-presidential choice are presently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. Reports state that Kamala will make her selection prior to August 7th. This market resolves to YES if/when Kamala Harris declares her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. It will resolve to NO if/when she announces another individual as her running mate. The decision must be officially confirmed by Kamala for it to resolve.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Nikki Haley going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other contenders will result in a **No**. This question is open to candidates not currently listed, as additional options may emerge later.

For the purpose of this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) select.

question.title: Conditional on Nikki Haley being the Republican nominee, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
This question explores the potential political dynamics if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution criterion for this condition is that Nikki Haley must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee.

Given this scenario, the outcome we are interested in is whether the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) will invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that President Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, thereby making the Vice President serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). It does not matter how long the incapacity lasts for this question to resolve as YES.

It should be noted that Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count for this question. The context involves discussions around the potential invocation of the 25th Amendment as raised by a GOP lawmaker.

para_P.title: If Nikki Haley is the Republican candidate, will Biden be declared unfit under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible political circumstances if Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The condition for this scenario is that Nikki Haley must be nominated by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Under these conditions, we are interested in whether the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) will activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare President Biden incapable of fulfilling the responsibilities of his office, thus allowing the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question to be answered with YES.

It is important to clarify that Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, or the application of section 3 of the 25th amendment does not apply to this inquiry. The focus is on the discussions regarding the potential use of the 25th Amendment as suggested by a GOP legislator.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) Nikki Haley becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden is officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if the following two conditions are satisfied:

(a) Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., or the invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment does not apply.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes, prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview occurred when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

This market will resolve to YES if Biden takes part in another in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO. 

This market does not consider press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. However, it may include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments of interviews featured in programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be valid. For instance, a 50-minute video might only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden’s interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes all contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden having an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there are at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. It does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. It will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: Assuming Joe Biden conducts a face-to-face interview lasting over 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024, will Donald Trump face removal or obstruction from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the following scenario: Joe Biden engages in a face-to-face interview or on-camera discussion for more than 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024. This can include appearances on podcasts or late-night television shows, or an interview that is incorporated into a program such as 60 Minutes, provided there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden in an in-person interview. However, this does not encompass press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, or town hall meetings.

Under these circumstances, will it be the case that Donald Trump is removed or obstructed from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the provisions of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This will be marked as "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially removed or obstructed from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as verified by official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. It will be marked as "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and (2) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(1) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, excluding press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. The interview must be released before the end of July 2024. Qualifying appearances include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. 

(2) Donald Trump must be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The resolution does not account for legal battles, appeals, or reversals after July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following take place: (1) Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, and (2) Donald Trump is either removed or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden needs to engage in a direct interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, not counting press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. The interview must be made public before the end of July 2024. Acceptable formats include podcasts, late-night television shows, or programs like 60 Minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person. 

(2) Donald Trump must be formally removed or prohibited from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be acceptable. The outcome does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or reversals that may occur after July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** only if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. 

For condition (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of these events will take place: (a) Hurd will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) A woman will be the Democratic candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** only if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) a female candidate is chosen by the Democratic delegates for the 2024 election. 

Regarding condition (a), it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined exclusively by the choice made by the Republican National Convention delegates.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the lead that Donald Trump has over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed in the chart for the date July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.
